Living in a farming community for generations, Chem has positive view for his future business. He does farming and in addition does fishing during free time from farming to earn extra money for his family. 

With the help of his wife and support from his children, Chem works hard day and night to improve his family's living conditions. He wants to spend more hours working and reduce utility fees;  however, it is a challenge for him because his house doesn’t have enough energy to generate light. He has to spend time and money go to charge a car battery every 3 or 4 days. 

As a result, he decided to apply for KIVA to buy a solar home systems. He believes he will save enough energy, utility fees, work more hours, and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system

location.town: Yeav Village, Kampong Cham Commune, Sambo District

loans.name: Jovencia

texts.en:
Jovencia has been a member of Paglaum MPC since 2005; since then, she has enjoyed the benefits of membership.

She wants to be secured, so she even took the insurance the cooperative offers to members. Recently, she took a loan to pay for the insurance renewal.

loans.use: to pay for insurance renewal

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en:
Pedrita is a hardworking mother from Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 65 years old and a businesswoman who makes copra. She buys whole coconuts for this. 

Pedrita has signed a membership with the Cooperative to gain access to insurances and credit. She applied for a loan to buy whole coconuts for making copra. Pedrita hopes to succeed in this business and to continue to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy whole coconuts to make copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production)

loans.name: Parkinimpou

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de deux enfants, Parkinimpo est une femme âgée de 29 ans résidant à Tokoin. Parkinimpo est une marchande  de produits d’alimentations générales qui s’approvisionne de ses marchandises cinq fois par mois au marché et le revend dans un garage non utilisé à son domicile. Parkinimpo demande ce prêt pour commander des sacs de riz, le bidon d’huile et le panier de tomates fraîches en vue d’avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit afin d’aider son mari à promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants et à subvenir aux charges quotidiennes éprouvées par sa famille.
texts.en:
Parkinimpo is twenty-nine years old, married and mother to two children. She lives in Tokoin and sells general food products. She buys her stock five times a month from the market and sells it from a disused garage at her home.

Parkinimpo has requested this loan to order sacks of rice, drums of oil and baskets of fresh tomatoes. Her increased stock levels will maximise her profit and allow her to help her husband provide for their children's education and pay for the day-to-day expenses of their family.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of rice, 1 drum of oil and 1 basket of fresh tomatoes.

loans.name: Arleen

texts.en:
Arleen is 34 years old, married, and has five children; three of which are in school.  

Arleen is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a frozen foods business in the Philippines. Arleen has been in this business for 5 years.

Arleen requested a 18,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more frozen foods to sell like hot dogs, ham, etc.

In the future, Arleen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods to sell like hot dogs, ham, etc.

loans.name: Yawavi

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 27 ans, Yawavi est femme habitant à Tokoin avec ses trois enfants à charge. Yawavi produit et vend du jus et de l’eau en sachets. Yawavi s’approvisionne du nécessaire quatre fois par mois au marché et revend sa marchandise dans sa boutique à domicile. Yawavi sollicite ce prêt pour commander des sachets d’eau et des  bols de sucre afin de répondre favorablement aux besoins de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière considérable pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Yawavi is twenty-seven years old, married and has three children in her care. She lives in Tokoin and produces and sells fruit and water in bags. She buys her raw materials four times a month from the market and sells her products in her shop in her home.

Yawavi has requested this loan to order bags of water and bowls of sugar for her business. She will meet the demands of her customers and improve her financial independence. This will allow her to contribute to her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 30 bags of water and 8 bowls of sugar.

loans.name: N6T2Tnhấtqvinh Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hồng is 49 years old and she is married. She lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

She has been working in agriculture raising poultry for 7 years.

Her family is a low-income household in the village.  The market need is low in this region, and the income from this business is unstable due to issues with poultry diseases. If the poultry die, the vendor is left with nothing to sell. The main hardship that Hồng faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more poultry to raise and sell in the future.

In 2014, Hồng joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Hồng has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.  She is the group leader of N6T2TNhấtQVinh, which consists of 3 members.

With her business profits, Hồng hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 43 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom is in school.

Helen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Helen has borrowed and paid 29 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twenty years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Helen aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Obed Josue

texts.es:
Obed es caracterizado por sus amigos y compañeros del trabajo como un joven trabajador, que no se rinde en ningún momento para cumplir sus sueños. A sus 27 años de edad ya es Licenciado en Derecho y trabaja como técnico de campo en poniendo en práctica lo aprendido en la universidad. Él decidió estudiar esta carrera, puesto que considera el derecho debe existir siempre ara que haya una justicia social.
Ahora que ya es egresado y se encuentra laborando, no quiere dejar sus sueños atrás, pues se mira en unos años haciendo una especialización de Derecho de familia, una rama que siempre le ha llamado la atención. No obstante Obed considera que primero debe seguir trabajando fuerte, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar una computadora que le ayudará a desempeñarse mejor en su trabajo. En sus otros planes está también formar parte de una firma prestigiosa.
texts.en:
Obed is described by his friends and coworkers as a hardworking young man. They say that he never gives up on his dreams. At 27 years of age, Obed has a law degree and works as a field technician, putting into practice what he learned in the university. Obed decided to study this field because he believes that the law must always exist in order for society to be just.

Now that he has graduated and is working, Obed does not want to leave his dreams behind. In a few years, he sees himself specializing in family law, a branch of the law that has always caught his interest. Nevertheless, Obed believes that first he should continue working hard. For this reason, he is requesting a loan in order to buy a computer that will help him to carry out his work better. Obed also plans to join a prestigious law firm.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Phea

texts.en:
Phea, a married farmer and father of 5 children, lives in Yeav village that is far from a power grid. As a farmer, he wants to expand his business which is in 3 hectares of land. 

He always gets up early to prepare his equipment to do farming. He gives his business his best effort in order to improve his family's living conditions. However, his current power/energy source won’t allow him to achieve this goal; it is money and time consuming.  Phea has to charge a battery every 2 or 3 days. After he found out that solar energy is the source he needs, he decided to apply for a KIVA loan to buy a good quality solar home system. He believes a solar home system can reduce his burden and help him achieve his goal.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system

location.town: Yeav Village, Kampong Cham Commune, Sambo District

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: Esperanza, tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene una hija y reside con ella y una hermana en el municipio de San Luis, Santa Barbara. Antes se dedicaba solo a labores de su casa, pero hace 5 años empezó con su negocio, se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo familiar (pulpería) y también vende ropa por encargo. La actividad la realiza de forma ambulante y la pulpería en su casa, algunos de los productos que ofrece son granos básicos, verduras, embutidos y productos de aseo y blusas, camisas, pantalones y otros. Ella  solicita un préstamo de 20,000 lempiras para comprar ropa, granos básicos, azúcar, refrescos, churros, productos de aseo, manteca, pan, huevos, harina etc. para vender, ya que esto le ayudara a mejorar su inventario. El plan de doña Esperanza es poner una tienda de venta de ropa y calzado, ampliar la pulpería, mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Esperanza is 31 years old, a single mother, she has one daughter and resides with her and a sister in the municipality of San Luis, Santa Barbara. Before, she only worked at the labors of the house, but 5 years ago she started with her business. She works selling family consumption products (a grocery store) and she also sells clothing on request. She does this activity on foot and the grocery store in her house. Some of the products she offers are basic grains, vegetables, deli meats, bathroom products and blouses, shirts, pants and others.

She is applying for a loan of 20,000 lempiras to buy clothing, basic grains, sugar, soda, churros, bathroom products, butter, bread, eggs, flour, etc. to sell, since this will help her grow her inventory. Esperanza's plan is to open a clothing and shoe store, grow the grocery store and improve her home.

loans.use: to buy clothing, basic grains, sugar, soda, churros, bathroom products, butter, bread, eggs, flour, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Maria Lilian

texts.es: Doña Maria de 64 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes porque vende una variedad de productos y a buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella solicita nuevamente un crédito para la compra de sopa, detergentes, granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, etc. para tener más productos y así tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria is 64 years old and lives in her own home along with her family. She runs a small store, located in her home and has many customers because she sells a variety of products at good prices. Her sales help Maria to pay her family's expenses.

Maria is requesting another loan in order to buy soup, detergent, basic grains, candy, soft drinks, etc. so that she can have more products and obtain more earnings.

loans.use: to buy soup, detergents, basic grains, candy, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es: Jose de 63 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el trabaja como fotógrafo desde hace 12 años, vende sus productos en los instituciones escolares y empresas y tiene clientes ya establecidos por su buen trabajo y los buenos precios, el quiere mejorar su vivienda construyedo una pared pero como no posee de suficiente capital esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de materiales de construccion y asi poder tener una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Jose is 63 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and son. For the last 12 years he has made a living as a photographer. He offers his services to schools and businesses and as a result of the quality of his work and competitive prices he has an established client base.
He wants to improve his home by building a wall however he does not have enough capital and so he is again asking for a loan to buy construction materials to be able to have a decent home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Ana Mirian

texts.es: Ana de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ell posee una tienda desde hace 4 años ubicado en su lugar de residencia, gracias a su trabajo es como ha podido salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. por mayor y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana is 42 years old and lives in her own house with her family. She has had a store for four years located in her place of residence. Thanks to her work she has been able to get ahead. She is requesting a loan to be able to buy more soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, pastries, etc. wholesale. Doing this she can have greater income for a higher quality of living.

loans.use: to buy more soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, pastries, etc. wholesale.

loans.name: Iliana Elizabeth

texts.es: Iliana de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de tarjetas de recargas para celulares desde hace 8 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas es como ha podido salir adelante junto con su familia, ella solicita nuevamente un crédito para la compra de tarjeta de recargas para celulares por mayor para continuar con su trabajo ya que es un producto muy vendible y asi poder tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en: Iliana, 31 years old, lives in her own house with her life partner and their two children. She has worked selling airtime balance cards for cellphones for the last 8 years. With what she obtains from her sales is how she's been able to get ahead with her family. She is applying for a loan again for the purchase of cellphone airtime cards in bulk in order to continue with her work since this is a very salable product; therefore she will be able to have a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to buy cellphone airtime cards in bulk.

loans.name: Ren

texts.en:
Ren and her husband are farmers and live in Yeav Village with their 3 children. Beside farming, Ren and her husband do fishing during fish season or free time. 

Ren is always concerned about her family's safety when she is not at home, since her family uses a car battery (as a power source) that has an acid substance. Moreover, she has to go charge the car battery every day for daily usage. It is a time and money consuming activity. Therefore, Ren decided to apply for a KIVA loan in order to buy a solar home system. 

A solar home system will bring her relief because her children will be safe.   Her family will have the convenience of having bright lighting in their home, and her children will be able to use the light by themselves without help from an elder.

loans.use: to buy a solar home system

location.town: Yeav Village, Kampong Cham Commune, Sambo District

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr: Agée de 37 ans, Ayawa est une femme qui vit à Baguida avec ses quatre enfants à charge. Mariée, Ayawa se bat énormément en revendant du piment rouge et des divers fruits qu’elle s’approvisionne trois  fois par mois au marché et le revend en circulant les quartiers environnant. Pour commander des sacs de piments rouges, Ayawa désire ce prêt pour financer son approvisionnement et réaliser une marge bénéficiaire afin de participer au mieux les charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Aged 37, Ayawa is a woman living in Baguida, raising her four children. She is married and strives to make a livelihood selling red peppers and various fruit. She stocks up three times a month at the market and sells her inventory by walking around the neighboring districts.

So as to order some sacks of red peppers, Ayawa would like to have this loan to cover the cost of restocking and make a profit so as to cover part of the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of dried red peppers.

loans.name: Niel

texts.en:
Niel thought he was in the right place when he joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. He decided to give it a try after he learned that he can avail financial assistance for his chosen business. 

Niel has maintained his membership in good standing without record of default up to this day. He has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. 

Recently, he availed a loan to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for his business. 

Niel wishes to manage his business more effectively with the support of his family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins

loans.name: Kifah

texts.en:
Kifah is a 30-year-old married woman from Deir Al-balah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. She lives with her family in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, her husband earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because she is not able to save enough money, Kifah took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, she will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient. This will help her to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Joel Aaron

texts.es: Joel un joven de 20 años de edad. Estudia la carrera de administración bancaria. Joel decidió estudiar  dicha carrera  interesado en tener su propio negocio juntamente a sus padres. Actualmente recibe el apoyo de sus padres. Así mismo trabaja como cajero en un banco. En esta ocasión solicitó el  crédito para el pago de la mensualidad de sus estudios. El deseo de Joel es de terminar satisfactoriamente su carrera, poder incorporarse al mercado laboral y posteriormente formar su propio negocio. Agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por facilitar dicho crédito ya que le permite su progreso.
texts.en:
Joel is a young man, 20 years of age. He studies the degree of bank administration. Joel decided to study said degree, interested in having his own business alongside his parents. Currently, he receives the support of his parents. At the same time, he works as a teller in a bank. On this occasion, he applied for a loan to pay for his monthly school payment.

Joel's desire is to finish his degree satisfactorily, be able to incorporate himself in the work market and later form his own business. He thanks the Kiva investors for facilitating said loan since it will permit his progress.

loans.use: to pay for his monthly school payment.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is managing her eatery business in Jimenez. She started the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. The business has done well in providing for the needs of the family. 

She has local customers and would also accept catering for added income. 

Recently, she requested a loan to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business. 

She wants to expand her business and would be happy to open a small food stall at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is a widowed woman, 64 years old with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Florentina has a direct selling business in the Philippines. Florentina requested a PHP 4000 loan amount through NWTF to buy stocks like perfume, body lotion, beauty soap and other personal care products.

Florentina has been in this business for 21 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks like perfume, body lotion, beauty soap and other personal care products

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maricar is 36 years old and has four children are currently in school.

Maricar has a buy and sell drinks business in the Philippines. Maricar requested a PHP 4000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more drinks and pro-bio-tic dairy products to sell.

Maricar has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more drinks and pre-biotic dairy products to sell

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mom is ages 47 years old living in a rural area of Kratie province and she is a mother of two children, one of whom is in school. Growing cassava and cashew are the sources of her family’s income for six years. Recently, the cassava has not grown well, which causes her to earn a lower income than before and it is really hard for her to support her family.

She is now forming as a group of two members to take a Kiva loan via VisionFund and this is the second loan cycle for her group. As the group leader, she is willing to use her loan portion to buy pesticide to protect her crop from being destroyed by insects. She hopes her cassava will grow healthily and able her to sell it at a higher price.

loans.use: to buy pesticide to protect her crop from being destroyed by insects and enable her to sell it at a higher price. .

loans.name: Enyonam

texts.fr: Enyonam est une femme mariée qui vit à Tokoin avec ses trois enfants à charge. Agée de 30 ans, Enyonam est une femme dynamique et courageuse  qui vend des amuse-gueules à domicile et dans les quartiers environnant afin de disposer d’une bonne capacité financière. Pour bien atteindre ses objectifs, Enyonam s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et désire ce prêt pour commander des amuse-gueules afin de financer son commerce et trouver un bon rendement pour subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens.
texts.en: Enyonam is a married woman who lives in Tokoin, raising her three children. Aged 30, Enyonam is a dynamic and courageous woman who sells snacks out of her home and in the nearby districts, so as to have enough income. In order to obtain her objectives, she stocks up once a month in the market. She wants to have this loan to order some snacks so that she can finance her business and have a good return on it to cover her daily needs.

loans.use: to buy 15 bowlfuls of snacks.

loans.name: Blanca Lydia

texts.es: Doña Blanca de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de refrescos desde hace varios años e inicio con capital propio su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes gracias a su trabajo es como ella puede salir a delante junto con su famila, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de horchata, leche, azucar, hielo, etc. para continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Blanca is 53 year old and lives in her own house with her husband and son. She has worked selling drinks for a number of years. She started with her own capital. Her business is located in her place of residence and she has many clients. Thanks to her work this is how she can get ahead with her family. She is requesting a loan to buy horchata (a cold drink make from ground nuts or seeds), milk, sugar, ice, etc. to continue her sales and have greater economic income.

loans.use: to buy horchata (a cold drink make from ground nuts or seeds), milk, sugar, ice, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is in agriculture. She is planting vegetables, and after the vegetables grow up, she brings them to the market to sell. She started to plant vegetables in 2002 with her own working capital of $200.

Now Maria is requesting a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to improve her business. Every day, her life is about planting vegetables because she is earning a good income from it. She is taking the loan from Tuba Rai Metin to increase her business by buying more manure, vegetable seeds, pumpkin seeds and other things.

loans.use: to buy more manure, vegetable seeds, pumpkin seeds and other things.

loans.name: Roque

texts.en:
Roque is a 34-year-old, married father of two children who works hard to support his family. He is a policeman and his wife is a housewife.

Although the family works very hard, it can be difficult for him to afford the cost of his education. This loan of $1,000 will allow Roque to graduate from his university. He will use the loan to pay for tuition, textbooks, school supplies and other things.

He is very happy and hopes that further education will help him to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition, textbooks, school supplies and other things.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 54 years old and married with five children.

Rosalinda is in an agricultural business farming rice and vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rosalinda has been farming rice and vegetables for thirty years now, and has borrowed 27 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosalinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Digna, 48, is married with three children. The children are in school.

Digna is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a buy-and-sell egg business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Digna has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy more eggs to sell.

In the future, Digna would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more eggs to sell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
From the bottom of her heart, Marites thanks *CCT and Kiva for their untiring spiritual and financial support for her transportation business for the past three years. That support has made it possible for her to properly maintain her tricycle, thus earn a steady family income.

Regular maintenance is necessary for the efficient and safe service of her tricycle. This leads her to request for another loan, for 15,000 Philippine pesos, to pay for new tires and an oil change and register her tricycle. She thanks God for your continuous support to her livelihood.

For the future, Marites hopes to acquire one more tricycle to improve her income. And she wants to see all of her children get a college education.

She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work and also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God, which she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for new tires and an oil change and register her tricycle.

loans.name: Domingos

texts.en:
Domingos is married. He has a carpentry business and is selling gasoline because he is earning a good income from this business. He lives near the main road, and every day, many people come to buy his gasoline, so he is still happy to do his business to generate income for his family.

He has been thinking about how to run a big business, but he does not have enough working capital. He felt better when he applied for his loan of $600. He wants to buy some additional supplies, such as gasoline, wood, saws, wood-cutting machines, machetes and a wood-hollowing machine.

Domingos is happy that TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) offers loan to poor people.

loans.use: to buy some additional supplies, such as gasoline, wood, saws, wood-cutting machines, machetes and a wood-hollowing machine.

loans.name: Phallen

texts.en:
Phallen, a handicraft man, lives in Achen Village with his wife and three children.

Phallen buys wood and crafts house furniture to sell to customers. He has to spend long hours to finish one item; therefore, he needs a lot of energy to run his business. However, a car battery is not reliable. It has a short life span and is easily damaged. Sometimes, the car battery runs out during night time.

After getting a good recommendation from a neighbor who uses a solar home system, Phallen decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy a solar home system. He believes this decision will improve his energy to run his business and will also save on utility fees.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: Achen Village, Kampong Cham Commune, Sambo Distric

loans.name: Maria  De Lourdez

texts.es:
La humildad y la cordialidad de Maria es la que hace que su pulpería, con más de cinco años de existir, se llene de clientes todo el tiempo. Su pequeño, pero fuerte negocio, inició cuando decidió invertir lo ahorrado, vendiendo comida en la calle. Para luego combinarlo con la venta de ropa de manera ambulante, siempre con la ayuda de sus tres hijos, de sus hermanos y de su esposo. 
A sus 41 años de edad, esta mujer desea seguir trabajando para salir adelante junto con su familia. Por esta razón, María solicita un préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, papel higiénico, pasta de dientes, café, pan, camisetas, pantalones, vestidos, ente otros productos que tanto solicitan sus clientes, de manera que podrá tenerlos satisfechos y captar a nuevos. En sus planes está agrandar su pulpería y diversificar más los productos.
texts.en:
The humility and cordiality of Maria is what makes her grocery store, with more than five years of existence, full of customers all the time. Her small but strong business started when she decided to invest the savings, selling food in the street. But later she combined it with the sale of clothing on food, always with the help of her three children, her two brothers and her husband.

At her 41 years of age, this woman wishes to continue working to get ahead with her family. For this reason, Maria is applying for a loan to buy rice, sugar, toilet paper, toothpaste, coffee, bread, t-shirts, pants, dresses, among other products that her customers order so much. In this manner, she will be able to have them satisfied and capture them again. In her plans is to enlarge her grocery store and diversify her products more.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, toilet paper, toothpaste, coffee, bread, t-shirts, pants, dresses, among other products.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther es conocida en su vecindario por ser una emprendedora de 54 años de edad, honesta y dispuesta a alcanzar sus metas con arduo trabajo. Hace dos años ella estableció su propia pulpería con sus ahorros, en la cual solo vendía lácteos y que a medida que iba pasando el tiempo iba nutriendo de diferentes productos hasta alcanzar lo que ahora tiene.
Esta emprendedora tiene el apoyo incondicional de su esposo, quien ha estado desde que inicio en esta aventura como comerciante. Ahora Esther está enfocada en invertir cada cierto tiempo, para poder llegar a ampliarlo más, razón por la cual solicita un préstamo para comprar leche, arroz, avena, verduras, pan, frijoles, entre otros productos para seguir diversificando su negocio. Esto le permitirá fortalecerlo e incrementar sus ingresos.  En sus planes está convertir su pulpería en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Esther is known in her neighborhood as an entrepreneur. She is 54 years old, honest and ready to reach her goals with hard work. Two years ago she opened her own grocery store with her savings where she only sold dairy products. With the passing of time she added different products until she reached what she has now.

This entrepreneur has the unconditional support of her husband who has been in this adventure since the beginning as a businessman. Now Esther is focusing on investing regularly to be able to expand more. This is the reason she is requesting a loan to buy milk, rice, oats, vegetables, bread and beans amongst other products to continue to diversify her business. This will allow her business to strengthen and increase her income. Amongst her plans are to convert her store into a wholesale supplier.

loans.use: to buy milk, rice, oats, vegetables, bread and beans amongst other products.

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 24 ans, Essi est une femme qui habite à Tokoin. Avec deux enfants à sa charge, Essi est une revendeuse des ustensiles en plastique. Essi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois et le revend en parcourant les quartiers. Essi sollicite ce prêt pour commander des douzaines de plats et gobelets afin de satisfaire parfaitement les attentes de ses clients et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour subvenir aux charges et besoins quotidiens de sa famille.
texts.en:
Married and aged 24, Essi is a woman living in Tokoin with two children for whom she is responsible. She sells dishes made of plastic. She stocks up on inventory twice a month and sells her goods by walking through the streets.

Essi is asking for this loan to order several dozen platters and cups so as to satisfy the needs of her clients fully and make a good profit margin to cover the daily expenses and needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy five dozen platters and five dozen cups.

loans.name: Sokh Neat

texts.en:
As part of a farming generation, Sokh Neat lives with husband and two children continuing her family business. Sokh Neat and her husband are hardworking farmers. They always get up early to prepare their equipment to do farming.

Sokh Neat puts in all her effort in order to make her family live in better conditions. However, her current power won’t make her achieve her goal. It is money- and time-consuming. She has to go to charge the battery every two or three days.

After she found out that solar energy is the source she needs, she decided to apply for a Kiva loan to pay for a good quality solar home system. She believes a solar home system can reduce her burden and make her achieve her goal.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: Achen Village, Kampong Cham Commune, Sambo Distric

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Sophal owns a small grocery shop with her 4 dependent children and husband. Her husband is a solder and, therefore, hardly stays at home.

Sophal has to take care of 4 children and also manages her own shop. She always has a concern about her family's safety when she is not at home or is busy with her shop since her family is using a car battery that has an acid substance for a power source. Moreover, she has to go to charge the car battery every day for daily usage. It is a time and money consuming activity.

She needs to stand by in the shop the whole day and consumes a lot of energy to run her business till night time, however the car battery is not reliable. Sometime the battery runs out without notice.

Therefore, Sophal is applying for a Kiva loan to buy a solar home system to sustain her business’s energy usage and also her family's usage. With a solar home system, she doesn’t have the concern about sudden power outage anymore.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: Achen Village, Kampong Cham Commune, Sambo Distric

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene, 33, is married with two children, one in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a crafts business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years.

Arlene has requested a loan of 16,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy shells and other supplies to use in her business.

In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more shells and other supplies to use in her business.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda, 48, is married with three children, two of whom are presently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Belinda has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years.

She has requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Seng Hong

texts.en:
Seng Hong owns a tailor shop for a living with her farmer husband and 1 child. Seng Hong's job requires long hours making and finishing 1 piece of clothing, therefore working till night time is necessary.

Currently, she uses a car battery to sustain her business energy, however a car battery is not reliable. It has a short life span and is easily damaged. Sometime the car battery runs out during night time.

After seeing the difficulty of using a car battery, Seng Hong decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy a solar home system. She believes this decision will improve her energy to run the business and also save utility fees.

loans.use: to pay for solar home system

location.town: Achen Village, Kampong Cham Commune, Sambo Distric

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Vanna sells some food at her house. She is living in Achen Village with 2 children and husband. Her husband works as a farmer and her oldest son works as an employee in a company.

Vanna needs to get up early to prepare food for selling. She needs a lot of energy to brighten her house in the early morning. However, a car battery is not reliable. It has a short life span and is easily damaged. Sometime the car battery runs out during her food preparation.

After getting good recommendation from a neighbor that uses solar home systems, she decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy a solar home system. She believes this decision will improve her energy to run her business and also save utility fees.

loans.use: to pay for solar home system.

location.town: Achen Village, Kampong Cham Commune, Sambo Distric

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 62 years old and has 11 children. Evelyn is married and has one child who is still in school.

Evelyn is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Evelyn has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Jeason

texts.en:
Jeason is a woman with one child and is 25 years old now. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Jeason has a shell craft business in the Philippines. Jeason requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy shell covers, thread, and other materials needed in her business.

Jeason has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Jeason would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy shell covers, thread, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 48 years old and has five children. Imelda is married, and three of her children are still in school.

Imelda is in the agricultural business of farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Imelda requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Imelda has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Imelda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Marian

texts.en:
Marian is a woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marian is 21 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Marian has a shell craft business in the Philippines. Marian requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy shell covers and other supplies to use in her business.

Marian has been in this business for six years. In the future, Marian would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy shell covers and other supplies to use in her business.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn, 49, is married with eleven children. Four of the children are currently in school.

Jonalyn is in the agricultural business, farming corn in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. She has borrowed six times in the past from the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to sustain her business.

She has requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en:
Harutyun repaid his first Kiva loan and he was sure that there will again be some cause to apply for one more deal with Kiva lenders. Harutyun is divorced and he lives with his retired mother in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. He has higher pedagogical education and many years already he works as a teacher of Armenian Language and Literature. He also has a nice hobby of painting.

Harutyun mentions that he is greatly happy for the choice of his profession and he likes to describe as pedagogy is his mission, and drawing is a reflection of his soul and inner peace. Harutyun must take part in paid training courses of teaching methodology and he ask this loan in order to pay for that courses which will significantly help him in his teaching process and he will also buy some professional literature.

loans.use: to pay for that courses which will significantly help him in his teaching process and he will also buy some professional literature

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 42 years old with two children. With two children in school, Elsa works very hard to provide for them.

Elsa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal care products, and other groceries.

She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Elsa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is aged 52 years, married with 3 children, he lives in Bundibugyo Uganda. He operates a workshop mainly by repairing electronics and gets additional income from his cocoa gardens. He started the business four years back to raise income for his family and school fees for the children.

His main challenge is limited capital and high cost of materials. He wants to construct a permanent house in future and educate his children. Ali has asked for a loan to buy repair materials and spares for his mechanic's workshop.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for use in his mechanic's workshop.

loans.name: Amadan

texts.en:
Amadan is a 35-year-old man living in Bundibugyo,Uganda. He has a retail shop. With the proceeds from his business, he has been able to pay school fees for his children and build a semi-permanent house. His business is hindered by price fluctuations, inadequate capital to purchase enough goods, and high taxes. Amadan's personal goals are educating his children and building a permanent house. His business goals are buying land to grow crops and moving his business into new markets.

The purpose of this loan is to buy general merchandise such as salt, rice, cooking oil and soap to sell. He used the previous loan for capital addition and was able to sell and realize good profits.

loans.use: to buy general merchadise such as salt, rice, maize flour and soap to sell.

loans.name: Nigube

texts.en:
Nigube is a married mother of six children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that  neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past six years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of seasonality in her business.

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 10,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: German

texts.es:
Los detalles y la creatividad, son la herramienta principal de German, un emprendedor de 34 años de edad, que desde hace quince años se dedica a ser ebanista, teniendo de ejemplo a su padre, quien se dedicaba a lo mismo. Para él este es un negocio rentable y lleno de pasión, pues cada pieza, cada mueble le da un toque especial que les gusta a los clientes. Él es padre de cuatro hijos entre las edades de tres a ocho años, quienes desea ver crecer como grandes profesionales, al igual que su esposa.
Últimamente, German tiene muchos pedidos, pues al ver sus muebles te darás cuenta del porqué. Por esta razón, él solicita un préstamo para comprar madera, clavos, serrucho, martillo, entre otros materiales indispensable para seguir ofreciendo un producto de calidad. Él sueña con tener un taller más grande y acondicionado para extenderse a más personas y así asegurar el futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Details and creativity are the main tools of German, an entrepreneur aged 34, who since fifteen years has worked as a cabinetmaker having his father as an example, who worked doing the same. For him, this is a profitable business and full of passion, with each piece, each furnishing, he gives a special touch that pleases his customers.

He is the father of four children, between the ages of three to eight years, who he desires to see grow as great professionals, like his wife. For this reason, he is applying for a loan to buy wood, nails, a handsaw, a hammer, among other indispensable materials to continue offering a quality product. He dreams of having a larger and conditioned workshop and to extend himself to more people and therefore assure the future of his children.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, a handsaw, a hammer, among other materials.

loans.name: Sokkhom

texts.en:
Sokkhom and his wife own a small grocery shop with 2 dependent children.

Sokkhom and his wife need to stand by in the shop the whole day and consume a lot of energy to run their business till night time, however their car battery is not reliable. Sometimes the battery runs out without notice. He has no choice but to close his shop early until the next day, which disturbs not only his living lifestyle but also his business.

Therefore, Sokkhom applied to Kiva for a loan to buy a solar home system to sustain his business’s energy usage and also his family's usage. With a solar home system, he doesn’t have to be concerned about sudden power outage anymore. He can run his business smoothly and save utility fees.

loans.use: to pay for solar home system.

location.town: Achen Village, Kampong Cham Commune, Sambo Distric

loans.name: Alexis

texts.es:
Alexis es de la ciudad de concepción, un lugar distante de la capital, está estudiando la carrera de veterinaria, comenta que por medio de la ayuda de sus padres está pudiendo estudiar y luchar por sus metas.
Es una persona muy luchadora que quiere ser alguien en la vida, es por ello que se está esforzando mucho. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Alexis is from the city of Concepcion, a place far from the capital. He is studying a degree in Veterinary Science. He says that with the help of his parents he is able to study and fight for his goals. 
He is a very hardworking person who wants to become someone in life. His is why he is making such a big effort. He is asking for this loan to be able to pay his university fees, and this way continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 28-year-old married mother of two. Three years ago, she started selling clothes to help her husband in covering the needs of their family. She has a good reputation among her region and has her loyal customers.
Hala is trying hard to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of fashionable clothes to satisfy her customers' needs.
Hala hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and stay capable of providing her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of fashionable clothes.

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit is 35 years old and she lives in Vanadzor city of Lori region. Lilit is divorced and she has a 5 years old daughter. Since she became alone in the care of her child, she decided to establish a business which still today is the best and the only source of income for her small family. At the city’ wholesale market she sells women clothes. She buys her stall’s merchandise from Yerevan once a month and she brings it to Vanadzor in a rented car.

Lilit says that she is very thankful very much to her regular customers and she does her best to keep her stall’s assortment fashionable and attractive for all of them. Now this loan of 300.000 Armenian drams Lilit asks as she wants to refresh her stall’s clothes assortment and she also wants to buy children clothes suitable for the coming academic year.

loans.use: to refresh her stall’s clothes assortment and she also wants to buy children clothes suitable for the coming academic year.

loans.name: Alexinah

texts.en:
Alexinah is aged 27 years. She has 2 children to support and has been in the business for the last 5 earning an income of KES20,000 per month.She has applied for her first loan of KES25000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase more farm input such as fertilizers for top dressing her crops.

She plans to educate his children and buy a dairy cow for milk production.She hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase more farm input such as fertilizers for top dressing his crops.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sandra, solicita un nuevo crédito por los buenos resultados que le dan y para mantener la continuidad de su negocio, comprara verduras, maíz, elotes, aceite y otros ingredientes para elaborar la venta de tamales, el resto lo utilizará para comprar gallinas indias y así mejorar la granja.
Con los créditos a tenido la facilidad de surtir el inventario de su negocio cada vez que lo requiere, manifiesta que tiene nuevos clientes y que su situación económica ha mejorado, de esta manera ofrece a su familia mejor alimentación y apoya a sus hijos para que sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
Sandra is asking for a new loan because of the good results it has brought her. To maintain the continuity of her business, she will buy vegetables, corn, maize, oil, and other ingredients to make tamales. The rest will be used to buy chickens and improve the farm.
With the loan, she has had the ability to stock her business inventory each time she needs it. She says she has new clients and that her economic situation has improved. In this way she offers her family better food and supports her children so they can continue studying.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, corn, maize, oil, and other ingredients to make tamales. The rest will be used to buy chickens and improve the farm.

loans.name: Jose Rene

texts.es: Jose, tiene 36 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijas, y reside en el municipio de Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara, con su esposa y sus hijas. Jose  antes se dedicaba  al cultivo de café, maíz y frijol.  Y hace 8 años mantiene su negocio de cría y engorde de ganado para vender. La cría de animales la tiene en su misma  propiedad y vende terneros y vacas para el destazo. El lleva el tercer ciclo de prestamo con la institución y es  por 27,000 Lempiras para invertirlo en la compra de 4 terneros para engordarlos y vender en un futuro. Con este prestamo va poder comprar un lote de terneros que le generara mejor ganancia. Su plan es seguir invirtiendo es esta actividad que realiza.
texts.en:
Jose is 36 years old and lives in a common-law realtionship with his partner with whom he has two daughters. He lives in the municipality of Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara with his wife and daughters. Before Jose worked growing coffee, corn and beans. For eight years he has maintained a business rising and fattening cattle to sell. He raises the cattle on his own property and sells calves and cows to butcher.

This is his third loan with the institution and is for 27,000 HNL to invest in the purchase of four calves to fatten and sell in the future. With this loan he will buy a group of calves that will generate greater profit. His plan is to continue to invest in his business.

loans.use: to buy four calves to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine, a 49 years old married mother of four children, is a Palestinian Refugee who has been working as a tailor for twenty five years to support her husband in covering their family's increasing living needs.
She lives and works in a Palestinian camp and is working hard to develop her family's living through developing her business and increasing her income.

Today, and since Catherine is investing her business income in covering her family's living needs, She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy a new sewing machine to develop her business as much as she can.
She hopes to stay capable of developing and improving her family's living to benefit from a better living.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine to develop her business as much as she can.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine with her husband lives in Vanadzor city of Lori region. They have two sons. Both of them are married and they live in Russian Federation with their families. Karine already 10 years with the help of her beloved husband runs clothes trading business. She rents a stall at the city’s wholesale market. She sells nice assortments of women clothes of various sizes and fashion.

Karine now wants to enlarge the assortment of children clothes as she hopes that with the start of the academic year she can have good sale. So with this loan amount she will buy a new assortment of clothes for school-aged children and she will also buy autumn season clothes for women.

loans.use: to  buy a new assortment of clothes for school-aged children and she will also buy autumn season clothes for women.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is aged 29 years. She has two children to support and she has been in the business for the last five earning an income of KES.20,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES.25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase more farm input such as fertilizers for top dressing her crops. Elizabeth plans to educate his children and buy a dairy cow for milk production.

She hopes to be financially stable in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more farm input such as fertilizers for top dressing her crops.

loans.name: Nora.

texts.en:
Nora is a mother of six and their only provider. She sells used shoes in a local market and also owns a tree planting nursery. By doing this Nora is able to meet her family needs and also move on well with her businesses.

She wants to stock more shoes, since they are in season the fact that children are going back to school, and thus expecting more sales. Nora is requesting for money to buy more shoes for selling.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for selling.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
María es propietaria de una tienda ubicada en su vivienda y en la que ofrece azúcar, aceite, jugos, boquitas y otros productos de primera necesidad, su horario de atención a los clientes es de siete de la mañana a seis y media de la tarde, tiene mucha experiencia en el negocio. Ella vive en casa propia con dos hijos y un nieto, tiene 50 años de tener el mismo domicilio, sus hijos tienen su propia actividad económica y se ayudan mutuamente para salir adelante.
Utilizará el crédito para comprar carnes, embutidos, lácteos, bebidas, golosinas entre otros productos nuevos para atraer a más clientes y satisfacer las necesidades de los que ya tiene, la inversión le facilitará adquirir mercadería al mayoreo a un precio bajo, espera administrar bien el capital y tener mejores ganancias.
Las aspiraciones que María tiene son pagar con puntualidad las cuotas de la deuda adquirida, seguir trabajando para salir adelante junto a su familia y hacer mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria is the owner of a store located in her home, and where she offers sugar, oil, juices, snacks, and other basic products. Her schedule to attend clients starts at seven in the morning until six thirty in the evening. She has a lot of experience with the business. She lives in a house she owns with her two children and one grandchild. She has had the same home for 50 years. Her children have their own economic occupation and they help each other to get ahead.
She will use the loan to buy meats, cold cuts, dairy products, drinks, and candies, among other new products to attract more clients and satisfy her current demand. The investment will help her to acquire merchandise at wholesale at a low price. She hopes to administer the capital well and have a better profit.

loans.use: to buy meats, cold cuts, dairy products, drinks, candies, among other new products to attract more clients and satisfy her current demand.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 21 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace 2 años a la elaboración y venta de piñatas, tiene mucha clientela ya establecida que la buscan por la calidad del producto y los buenos precios, la joven vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas materiales como: pegamento, papel de colores, papel periódico, alambre, etc. y continuar con su trabajo ya que le ha ido muy bien en sus ganancias.
texts.en:
This young woman, whose face is pixelated because she is 21 years old and lives in a high risk area, has made a living creating and selling piñatas for the past 2 years. She has an established customer base, and her customers search for her as a result of the quality and good pricing of her products. This young woman lives in her own house with her life partner and her son.

She is requesting a loan once again in order to buy more materials such as glue, colored paper, newspaper, wire, etc. so that she can continue with her work, since she has been doing very well and earning a good income.

loans.use: to buy glue, colored paper, newspaper, wire, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is 45 years old and married with eight children, five of whom are in school. Ma. Fe works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Fe runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, juice, bread, soap, shampoo, and snack foods.

Ma. Fe has been in this business for 1 year.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, juice, bread, soap, shampoo, and snack foods.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 45 years old, with two children. Mary Ann works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Ann runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, rice, home product care, and other groceries.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Mary Ann would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, rice, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 50 years old and has seven children. Merlinda is married and has two children who are still in school.

Merlinda is in the agricultural business, farming corn in the Philippines. Merlinda requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer, corn seed and other farm supplies.

Merlinda has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, corn seed and other farm supplies

loans.name: Merilou

texts.en:
Merilou is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Merilou is 41 years old.

Merilou has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Merilou requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy variety of fish to sell.

Merilou has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Merilou would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Letilia

texts.en:
Letilia is 73 years old, married, and has six children.  

Letilia is in the agricultural business, selling ornamental plants in the Philippines. Letilia requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her ornamental plants.

Letilia has been growing ornamental plants for ten years now and has borrowed 24 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Letilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her ornamental plants.

loans.name: Rhea

texts.en:
Rhea is a woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rhea is 30 years old and one of her children is in school.

Rhea has a shell crafting business in the Philippines. Rhea requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more shells and other supplies to use in her business.

Rhea has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Rhea would like to save enough to provide a secure living for her family.

loans.use: to buy more shells and other supplies to use in her business

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe, está solicitando un nuevo crédito para comprar madera y una cierra electica para fabricar juguetes de madera, es un nuevo rubro que le está generando mejores ganancias por lo que ha dejado de vender calzado y ropa para dedicarse de lleno a esta actividad. 
La ayuda que le dio el crédito anterior ha dado buenos resultados, su negocio es más rentable y puede cubrir sus gastos familiares.
texts.en: Guadalupe is asking for a new loan to buy wood and an electric saw to make wooden toys. This is a new line of business;  generating better earnings than selling footwear and clothing so he has stopped that to fully devote himself to this activity. The support provided by the prior loan has produced good results, his business is more profitable and he can meet his family expenses.

loans.use: buy clothing, shoes and wood. He thinks properly stocked inventory will allow him to continue working and avoid problems to satisfy his clients' needs.

loans.name: Edvard

texts.en:
Edvard started farming with his father when he was 15 years old and he has developed his farm and has some ideas connected with its enlargement. He lives in frontier city Ijevan of Tavush region with his wife, son and retired mother. Edvard is good in cattle care (he has cows, calves, sheep and chickens), but his agricultural activities are also a lot. On his plot of land, he cultivates potatoes, beans, cucumber, tomatoes and greens. He also has trees of persimmon, nuts and cherry. All these harvest with his farm products (milk, meat, cheese and eggs) Edvard sells at the city’s wholesale market.

Edvard mentions that he would like to develop swine breeding in his farm and he will be thankful if Kiva lenders help him with loan amount as he wants to buy several piglets, several chickens and also fodder for farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy several piglets, several chickens and also fodder for farm cattle

loans.name: Eriberta

texts.en:
Eriberta is 49 years old and married with four children, two of whom are enrolled in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Eriberta has a rice-retailing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eleven years. Eriberta requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more rice to sell.

In the future, Eriberta would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 47 years old and the mother of eight children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Leonila has a rice-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. Leonila requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more rice to sell.

In the future, Leonila would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Eduardo Antonio

texts.es:
Eduardo está casado y tienen 4 hijos de 3, 5, 10 y 13 años de edad, comenta que no tiene parientes en el extranjero, su fuente de ingresos es dar el servicio de transporte en su vehículo propio, lo inicio por motivación propia y con esfuerzo compro su vehículo, por el momento no representa dificultades en seguir trabajando.
Con el propósito de ampliar su negocio solicita un crédito para pagar la reparación de un coche para elaborar hot dogs, así atenderá otro tipo de clientes y generará ingresos extras para mejorar las condiciones de vida familiar.
Sus planes para el futuro son seguir trabajando, cancelar su deuda con buen record y dar a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Eduardo is married and has four children aged 3, 5, 10 and 13 years old. He comments that he has no family outside the country. His source of income is to provide transportation services with his own vehicle. He started this on his own initiative and with effort bought his vehicle. At present he has no problem continuing this work.

With the goal of expanding his business he is requesting a loan to pay to repair a vehicle to prepare hot dogs to serve another type of client. This will generate extra income to improve the family's living conditions.

His plans for the future are to continue to work, pay off his debt in good time and provide his family with a better life.

loans.use: to pay to repair a vehicle to prepare hot dogs to serve another type of client.

loans.name: Digna Emerita

texts.es:
Digna, tienen un negocio más competente con el apoyo que tiene de la institución por medio del créditos, pues ha mejorado la producción de granos básicos y en la panadería está elaborando nueva variedad de pan.
Reconoce que es importante tener a su disposición los materiales necesarios para seguir trabajando, opta por un nuevo crédito para comprar manteca, harina, huevos, azúcar, etc., para seguir produciendo pan, el resto servirá para invertirlo en insumos agrícolas y pagar obreros para seguir cultivando granos básicos, espera tener resultados positivos.
texts.en:
Digna managed to improve her business with her last loans. She increased her production of basic grains and bakes more varieties if bread in her bakery.
Since she knows how important it is to have supplies at the ready to keep in business, she asks for a new loan to buy butter, flour, eggs, sugar, and other ingredients she needs for her bakery. The rest of the money will go towards buying farm supplies and hiring farm hands to tend to the crops. She hopes for positive results.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients she needs for her bakery.

loans.name: Phonngam Group

texts.en: Som understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Som knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Som purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    Som is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Naphao Group

texts.en: Deuanma understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families.  Deuanma knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Deuanma purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water, if it is available.  Deuanma is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Phonnadee Group

texts.en: Xiengdao’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without being boiled first.  Xiengdao and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  Xiengdao and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their families' budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Xiengdao’s family, see a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Wahid

texts.en:
Wahid is a 39-year-old married father of two. He started twenty five years ago maintaining mobile phones to cover his family's needs and expenses. He is a hard worker and ambitious man who deprives himself for the sake of his children.

Today, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay his daughter's school tuition fees. Wahid's daughter is very clever and intelligent and he is really very proud of her. He hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay his daughter's school tuition fees

loans.name: Dongphao Group

texts.en: Pheng understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Pheng knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Pheng purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost of foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water, if it is available. Pheng is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Parkkadngtai Group

texts.en: Thom is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Thom and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Thom and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Thom and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. After totaling up the costs, Thom and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nazi

texts.en:
Nazi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attends school. She owns a  house that  neither has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Khoksawang Group

texts.en: Hongkham is excited the filter was available on an affordable payment plan.  Hongkham and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Hongkham and his group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Hongkham and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Hongkham and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Los Morelos Group

texts.es:
En un poblado veracruzano se integró un grupo que lleva el nombre de Los Morelos. Durante el recorrido para llegar a su comunidad se pueden apreciar los sembradíos de caña de azúcar, sorgo, mango, maíz o el tradicional “nanche”. De esta manera la mayoría de los habitantes dedican su vida a trabajar en el campo.
   Todos los miembros del grupo son: Emiliano quien se dedica a la venta de caña de azúcar; Mirna, a la carpintería; María, a la cría de cerdos; Concepción, a una farmacia; Deysi, a la venta de carne; Dulce, vende cosméticos y Gloria, refrescos y pan. 
   Doña Concepción es conocida por toda la gente como “Concha” o “Conchita” ya que tiene un carácter muy amigable. Es madre de 10 hijos quienes ahora son totalmente independientes. Durante 36 años se desempeñó como enfermera en la clínica de su comunidad por lo que adquirió los conocimientos y practica necesaria para iniciar con una farmacia establecida desde hace 8 años. No obstante su labor no sólo se remite a vender los medicamentos ya que brinda primeros auxilios y toma los signos vitales a la gente que lo necesite; “el que no nace para servir, no sirve para vivir” son sus palabras al expresar la responsabilidad que siente para con su actividad. Su negocio abre de lunes a domingo  en un horario fijo, sin embargo si existe alguna emergencia no tiene ningún inconveniente en atender a sus clientes fuera del horario.
   Con las ganancias obtenidas puede solventar sus gastos además de invertir en la compra de medicamentos (analgésicos, antigripales, antibióticos, jeringas, gasas) con el firme propósito de brindar la mejor calidad a sus clientes y sobre todo precios accesibles. En esta ocasión necesita el préstamo para comprar antigripales, analgésicos, vendas y gasas ya que son los productos de mayor demanda.
*La fotografía fue tomada en la región conocida como la novia del sol, Doña Concha es quien viste blusa floreada falda color rosa.
texts.en:
A group called 'Los Morelos' was formed in a village of the state of Veracruz. On the way to the village, you can see sugar cane, sorgho, mango, maize, and nanche fields. Most of the inhabitants of the village are thus farmers.
   The members of the group are: Emiliano, who sells sugar cane; Mirna, a carpenter; María, who raises pigs; Concepción, an apothecary; Deysi, who sells meat; Dulce, who sells cosmetics; and Gloria, who sells drinks and bread.
   Concepción is know by all by her monikers, 'Concha' or 'Conchita'. She is a very amiable person. She has 10 children, all of whom live now on their own. She was a nurse at the village's clinic for 36 years, which is where she acquired all the knowledge and experience necessary to open her own apothecary, which she did eight years ago. She does not just sell medicine, she also gives first aid and assesses people's health for those who need it. "If you are not born to help others, you are useless to society", she says to drive home how big a responsibility she feels she has. Her shop is open Mondays to Sundays  at fixed times. Of course, should an emergency arise, the doors will open regardless of the hour.
   With her profits, she is able to cover expenses and buy medicine and supplies (analgesics, cold medicine, antibiotics, syringes, gauze) to replenish her stock. Her aim is to always provide her customers with quality products at an affordable price. She needs this loan to buy analgesics, cold medicine, bandages, and gauze, which are always in high demand.
* The picture was taken in an area known as 'La novia del sol' (The sun's fiancee). Concha is wearing a flowery top and a pink skirt.

loans.use: to buy cold medicine, analgesics, bandages, and gauze.

location.town: LOCALIDAD JOSE MARIA MORELOS, TIERRA BLANCA VERACR

loans.name: Ida Ivette

texts.fr: Ida est une femme mariée âgée de 36 ans résidante à Tokoin. Mère de deux enfants, Ida est une revendeuse des produits alimentaires et céréales qu’elle revend à  la devanture de son domicile et dans les quartiers environnant. Ida s’approvisionne du nécessaire deux fois par mois  au marché et désire ce prêt pour commander des paniers de tomates fraîches, de piment vert et de légumes. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Ida compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et aider Sa famille à avoir un épanouissement et une bonne éducation.
texts.en:
Ida is a thirty-six year-old married woman living in Tokoin. She is a mother of two.

Ida retails groceries and cereal from the front of her house and in nearby neighborhoods. Ida procures what she needs twice a month from the market and wants this loan to order baskets of fresh tomatoes, green peppers, and vegetables.

With the resulting profit margin, Ida plans on improving her selling experience and help her family achieve well-being and a good education.
