loans.use: to buy five baskets of fresh tomatoes, five baskets of green papers, and four baskets of vegetables.

loans.name: Afissétou

texts.fr: Avec trois enfants à sa charge, Afissétou est une femme mariée qui vit à Tokoin pour exercer ses activités. Agée de 46 ans, Afissétou est une marchande de toutes catégories de sacs de friperies. Afissétou s’approvisionne de ses marchandises deux fois par mois au marché et le revend dans en parcourant dans les services, puis le marché. Afissétou demande ce crédit pour commander des unités de sacs de sortie  et de voyage afin de gagner  une marge bénéficiaire assez élevée pour pouvoir couvrir les charges quotidiennes dont elle éprouve et veiller à ce que les enfants soient dans de bonnes conditions de vie.
texts.en:
With three dependent children, Afissétou is a married woman living in Tokoin to run her business. She is forty-six years old.

Afissétou retails all types of second-hand bags. She procures merchandise twice a month from the market, and resells door-to-door and then at the market.

Afissétou is requesting this loan to order travel bags and bags for going out, so that she can earn a profit margin high enough to cover her daily expenses and to make sure her children enjoy good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy ten travel bags and ten bags for going out.

loans.name: Alwar Cmt Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 11 juillet 2002. Ce groupe est composé de vingt femmes qui s'activent dans le commerce. Madame Antoinette qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est veuve, âgée de 57 ans et mère de sept enfants dont cinq filles. Elle s'active dans la vente d'huile de palme et du citron depuis plus de dix ans. Elle va acheter quatre bidons de vingt litres d'huile de palme et deux bidons de vingt litre de jus de citron. Elle est très expérimenté dans son domaine d'activité et très connu dans sa localité. les bénéfices vont servir à la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
The village finance group was inaugurated on July 11, 2002. It is composed of twenty women, all active in retail.

Ms. Antoinette, who is on the right with her hand raised in the photo, is the group's delegate. She is a fifty-seven year-old widow and a mother of seven children, including five daughters. She has been in business selling palm oil and lemon for over ten years.

She will purchase four twenty-liter containers of palm oil and two twenty-liter containers of lemon juice. She has a lot of experience in her domain and is well-known in her village. Profits will be used to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and lemon.

loans.name: Baghagha Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 20 juin 2002. Ce groupe est constitué de dix femmes qui développent des activités commerciales. Madame Aramatoulaye qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est célibataire sans enfant et âgée de vingt ans. Elle s'active depuis deux ans dans la vente de crevette et du poisson. Elle va acheter deux cartons de crevettes et deux paniers de poissons. Elle a un clientèle qui lui est fidèle, ce qui lui permet d'écouler rapidement sa marchandise. les bénéfices vont servir à s'occuper de ses parents et à les assister dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The village finance group was created on June 20, 2002. This group is composed of ten women who are developing commercial businesses.

Ms. Aramatoulaye, who is on the right with her hand raised in the photo, is the group's delegate. She is single and does not have children. She is twenty years old.

She has been in business selling shrimp and fish for two years. She will purchase two boxes of shrimp and two baskets of fish. She has a loyal clientele, which allows her to turn her merchandise rapidly.

Profits will be used to take care of her parents and help them with daily expenses.

loans.use: purchase shrimp and fish.

loans.name: Manyeso

texts.en:
Manyeso is a 39 year old mother of two at Kilifi Kenya whose business involves roasting ground nuts and cashew nuts for snacks.

She is a married woman house spouse provides with additional income and has been in this business for the last twenty one years doing well.

This is her first borrowing to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase cashew nuts and ground nuts and the anticipated profits to expand her business. she hopes to build a snack shop in future.

loans.use: to purchase cashew nuts and ground nuts

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Divorcée et âgée de 46 ans, Adjo est femme qui vit à Tokoin avec un enfant à charge. Adjo produit et vend du jus fait avec du maïs et du sucre généralement appelé « LIHA ». Adjo s’approvisionne du nécessaire deux fois par mois au marché et revend sa marchandise au bord de la route et de quartier en quartier. Adjo sollicite ce prêt pour commander des bols de maïs, de sucre et de farine de blé afin de répondre favorablement aux besoins de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière considérable pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation.
texts.en:
Adjo is a forty-six year old divorced woman. She lives in Tokoin with one dependent child.

Adjo prepares and retails juice made with corn and sugar, generally called "Liha." Adjo procures the necessary supplies twice a month from the market and sells her merchandise by the roadside and itinerantly.

Adjo is requesting this loan to order bowls of corn, sugar, and wheat flour to meet her customers' needs and gain solid financial autonomy, so she can help her child get an education.

loans.use: to buy thirty bowls of corn, eighteen bowls of sugar, and eighteen bowls of wheat flour.

loans.name: Maruf

texts.en: Maruf is a caring father. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1966, and now he lives in a small town with his family. He is married and has three children. He has bred livestock for almost 20 years, and he also works in construction. He wishes for his children to attain higher education degrees. He asked for a loan through IMON to pay for his son's university tuition. He awaits KIVA lenders kindness and support.

loans.use: to educate his son in a higher education institute

loans.name: Teodocia

texts.en:
Teodocia thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can avail herself of financial assistance for her chosen business.

Teodocia has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner.

Recently, she took a loan to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for her chosen business. Teodocia wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann, 45, is married with three children, two of whom are still in school. Mary Ann works very hard to provide for them. For six years she has operated a general store in the Philippines. Mary Ann requested a 5000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, shampoo, bread, milk, coffee, snack foods, etc. In the future Mary Ann would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Romely

texts.en: Romely is 42 years old and married with seven children. For 15 years she has farmed rice in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from selling dried fish. Romely is borrowing 8000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 55 years old and married with nine children. With one child in school, Melinda works very hard to provide for the family.

Melinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, biscuits, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Melinda has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as rice, soft drinks and liquors.

In the future, Melinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, biscuits, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: La Palma Verde Group

texts.es:
La mayoría de los habitantes de cierta localidad mexiquense tiene que viajar diariamente hasta la capital para ofrecer distintos servicios, en especial los de albañilería. No obstante cualquier esfuerzo es poco si se trata de ofrecer mayores oportunidades a sus familias. Los demás habitantes hacen lo propio desde los campos de cultivo donde siembran la papa, o bien en la cría de ganado. 
   El grupo La Palma Verde es originario de dicha comunidad y su nombre hace referencia a una gran palmera que identifica a su localidad. Al ser un territorio pequeño, todos se conocen y llevan una buena relación de vecinos.
   Patricia es una mujer trabajadora y amable cuya mayor motivación es su pequeño hijo a quien ha tenido que criar sola. Desde hace más de diez años se ha dedicado a la elaboración de manteles, servilletas y otros tipos de bordados artesanales. Para Paty, como le llaman de cariño, esta actividad es una tradición ya que su madre y abuela le enseñaron a bordar, “ellas decían que una buena ama de casa debería elaborar sus propias servilletas para envolver las tortillas” comentó con una sonrisa. 
  En un mes realiza tres o cuatro bordados aproximadamente lo que representa una ganancia estable, los clientes suelen llevarle los materiales necesarios con los que se encarga de llevar a cabo su obra. El préstamo le es de gran ayuda pues le resulta complicado reinvertir en materiales para su labor; por lo tanto aprovecha al máximo este beneficio. Ahora con la ayuda pretende comprar hilos, tela cuadrille, agujas, etc. La meta de Paty es aumentar su producción para ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo por medio de la educación, del mismo modo desea formar un patrimonio para el futuro.
   Las demás integrantes del grupo son Ma. del Socorro, Agripina y Juliana quienes invertirán en la compra de ovejas para su cría. 
*La fotografía fue tomada en las escalas del quiosco municipal, Paty es quien viste la sudadera rosa.
texts.en:
The majority of the inhabitants of a certain Mexican location have to travel to the capital daily to offer various services, especially those of masonry. Nevertheless, any effort is little if it is a matter of offering better opportunities to their families. The other residents make their own efforts from the farm fields where they raise potatoes or cattle.

The group La Palma Verde is from this community, and its name refers to a great palm tree that identifies their location. Because it is a small area, everyone knows each other, and they have good neighborly relationships.

Patricia is a hard-working and friendly woman whose great motivation is her little son, whom she has had to raise alone. For more than 10 years, she has made tablecloths, napkins, and other types of embroidered handicrafts. For Paty, as she is affectionately called, this work is a tradition, since her mother and grandmother taught her to embroider. "They said that a good housewife should make her own napkins for wrapping the tortillas," she comments with a smile.

In a month, she makes approximately three or four embroideries, which represents stable earnings. The customers usually bring her the necessary materials with which she has the task of completing her work. The loan is a great help for her, since it becomes complicated for her to reinvest in materials for her work. Thus she takes maximum advantage of this benefit. Now, with the help, she plans to buy thread, checked fabric, needles, etc. Paty's goal is to increase her production in order to offer a better quality of life to her son through education. In the same way, she wants to create an inheritance for the future.

The other members of the group are Maria del Socorro, Agripina, and Juliana, who will invest in the purchase of sheep to raise.

The photograph was taken on the steps of the municipal market. Paty is the one wearing the pink sweatshirt.

loans.use: to buy thread, checked fabric, etc.

location.town: SAN JOAQUIN LAMILLAS, SAN JOSE DEL RINCON

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita wants to help her daughter fulfill her dream of completing a college degree. She religiously attends to her eatery so that she can makes good sales. Teresita is in need of an amount to pay for the school fees of her daughter for another school year. Teresita has big dreams to help all her children, which is why she works hard for their education.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's school fees.

loans.name: Rasminah

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet Rasminah, one of KPP UMKM’s clients. Rasminah is 67 years old and married. She lives with her husband, her children and her son- and daughter-in-law. Rasminah is a housewife, and her husband has been a farmer for 10 years. They pull together to increase the family income.

Rasminah has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for IDR 4,500,000. This loan will be used to buy and build a water source at her home to improve access to water and sanitation for her family. She wants to have access to safe sanitation and water sources for her family.

Her family income is still not enough to build toilets and water sources with cash, but they are able to repay loans received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to buy and build a water source at her home to improve access to water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Shirly is 45 years old and three of her children are presently in school.

Shirly has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients, like bananas, cooking oil, sugar, and flour, and other materials for her food-production business.

Shirly has been in this business for 6 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, like bananas, cooking oil, sugar, and flour, and other materials for her food production business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 45 years old and has five children. She is married and two of her children are in school.

Elena is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Elena has been raising pigs for 10 years now and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Luceros Group

texts.es:
Cierto municipio oaxaqueño se caracteriza por tener una gran riqueza en su tierra, motivo por el cual la mayor parte de la población se dedica a la agricultura. Los campos que adornan el paisaje se dividen entre cultivos de caña de azúcar, maíz, fríjol, arroz, mango, papaya, café y vainilla. Del mismo modo, la pesca ha ganado un papel importante en la actividad económica debido a que muchas personas visitan la localidad para adquirir pescado fresco y de gran calidad. 
   De dicha comunidad es originario el grupo Luceros cuyos integrantes son: Apolonia quien vende refrescos; Juan y Luisa, pescado; Verónica, comida típica y Abigail, cosméticos. Por su parte Marco maneja una vulcanizadora y Petra, una lavandería. 
   Marco Antonio es un joven que, además de apoyar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, quiere brindar un gran ejemplo a sus hermanos pequeños. Toño, como lo conocen sus amigos, trabajó durante un año en una vulcanizadora de su comunidad, sin embargo su carácter emprendedor lo llevo a crear un negocio propio desde hace cinco años. Con base en su calidad y buena atención a logrado ampliar su local además de expandir su labor a motocicletas. Al inicio contaba con una cuña y una espátula, además el espacio era muy pequeño por lo que gran parte del servicio lo llevaba a cabo en el exterior del local; hoy en día el espacio es mucho más amplio y su herramienta incrementó. “Termino lleno de grasa y polvo pero no importa pues mis clientes quedan satisfechos y yo me gano la vida de manera honrada” comenta entusiasmado. Como se mencionó, parte de su éxito radica en la atención pues brinda servicio a domicilio y si el cliente no tiene para pagar el total les brinda  crédito.
   Para Toño el préstamo significa una nueva inversión con la cual el crecimiento de su actividad sería más notable. En un futuro desea brindar empleo a otras personas, además de abrir otra sucursal. En esta ocasión invertirá el crédito en la compra de parches, pegamento y una espátula.
*Ellos son los integrantes del grupo, Toño es quien se encuentra de pie sobre el antiguo pozo, viste playera negra.
texts.en:
One municipality in Oaxaca is distinguished by the great richness of it's land. This is the reason that the greater part of the population works in agriculture. The fields that dot the landscape are divided into crops of sugar cane, corn, beans, rice, mango, papaya, coffee and vanilla. At the same time fishing has gained an important role in the economic activity as many people visit the area to acquire fresh and good quality fish.

This community is the home of the "Lucero" group whose members are: Apolonia who sells soft drinks; Juan and Luisa sell fish; Verónica sells traditional food and Abigail sells cosmetics. As for Marco he runs a tire repair business and Petra operates a laundromat.

Marco Antonio is a youth who, besides helping his parents with the household expenses, wants to provide a good example for his younger siblings. Toño as he is known by his friends, worked for a year in a tire repair shop in his community. However his enterprising character lead him to create his own business five years ago. Based on the quality and good service he has managed to expand his shop and extend his services to include motorcycles. In the beginning he only had a wedge and a tire iron and his space was very small so most of his work had to be taken outside to do. Today his area is much bigger and his equipment has increased. "I end up covered in grease and dirt but that is not important as my customers are satisfied and I earn my living in an honest way" he commented with enthusiasm. As mentioned part of his success comes from his service, plus he offers home service and if the client can't pay the bill he offers them credit.

For Toño the loan represents a new investment which will make the growth of his business more noticeable. In the future he wants to provide employment for other people and open another branch. At this time he will invest the loan in the purchase of patches, glue and a tire iron.

*These are the members of the group. Toño is standing on the old well wearing a black t-shirt.

loans.use: to buy patches, glue and a tire iron.

loans.name: Dodo

texts.en:
Dodo is 43 years old married woman. She lives in Zugdidi with her husband Mamia, who is an artisan and repairs cars. Dodo bakes cakes and sells if she has orders from her villagers to generate income. She decided to start more stable business and requested a loan.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan. With the received credit Dodo will purchase a stock of nuts to resell. Dodo will generate more income and will be able to improve the living conditions for her family. She thinks that the business will be profitable and awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin trade nuts

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 36-year-old married mother of three children, who opened three years ago a clothes selling shop to support her husband in covering their family's increasing living needs and education.
Fatima is working on increasing her business capita, but her family's requests stops her from taking any step forward, thus an acquired loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua was her best choice. Through her acquired loan, Fatima will increase her business merchandise with special Autumn and winter collection, she will also support her husband in making necessary maintenance to his small van which he uses to transport students.

She hopes to open a wider shop in the future to increase her capital, and expected income.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a special Autumn and winter collection.

loans.name: Leonela

texts.en:
Leonela has been a dried fish retailer for 20 years. She is doing well with her business and makes good sales with which she sufficiently supports the needs of her family.

She is glad that she is supported by Paglaum MPC with her business ventures. Recently, she took a loan to purchase additional inventory of dried fish for retail sale.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory of dried fish for retail sale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can avail herself of financial assistance for her chosen business.

Maria has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner.

Recently, she took a loan to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for her chosen business. Maria wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.en:
Cecilio makes a living through his retailing business. He runs a lumberyard in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, and earns a promising income to support his family.

He has signed up for his membership with PMPC to gain access to capitalization. He wants to increase his inventory. Now, he has taken a loan to purchase more lumber to sell.

Cecilio hopes to sustain his business and dreams to send all his children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more lumber to sell

loans.name: La Espiga Group

texts.es:
El denominado “pan de fiesta” es elaborado con anís, nuez, leche, nata, entre otros ingredientes; es endulzado con piloncillo lo que también le otorga un sabor único. Una comunidad mexiquense es celebre por tener a los panaderos que mejor realizan dicho producto. Las recetas que utilizan han pasado de generación tras generación y para ellos más que una actividad económica es una tradición digna de orgullo.
   Fermina es integrante del grupo La Espiga cuyo nombre hace referencia a la rama de donde provienen los granos que finalmente se convierten en harina: materia prima de su actividad, la panadería. Ella es una mujer infatigable, está dispuesta a trabajar intensamente en favor de sus hijos quienes se encuentran estudiando. 
   “Ahora yo soy la tercera generación que se encarga del negocio y mis hijos también están aprendiendo a elaborar este tradicional pan” comentó Fermina quien lleva doce años a cargo de la panadería. Desde pequeña observaba como sus padres salían a vender su producto en ferias, convenciones y fiestas de alguna comunidad. Al inicio solían cocinar con leña, mas actualmente tienen hornos de gas y cuentan con locales adaptados a su actividad. Al ser originaria de la región donde mejor se realiza el “pan de fiesta”, la competencia es mucha pero lejos de preocuparse por ello se dedica a mejorar cada vez más su calidad y sabor para que los clientes continúen buscando su producto.
    Con el beneficio del préstamo compraría harina, levadura, azúcar etc. siendo éstos los ingredientes que más utiliza. Cabe mencionar, que se encuentra muy contenta y motivada porque cada inversión realizada se ve reflejada en las atractivas ganancias que obtiene. Uno de sus sueños es abrir otro negocio para brindar educación a sus hijos; “mi hija quiere estudiar una carrera en informática y yo quisiera que sus sueños se hagan realidad” comentó muy contenta Fermina.
   Las demás integrantes del grupo son Francisca, Cristina y Magdalena quienes, de igual forma, invertirán en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de pan.
**La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del quiosco municipal, Fermina es quien viste una chamarra verde.
texts.en:
The so-called 'pan de fiesta' is made with aniseed, walnuts, milk and cream, among other ingredients. It is sweetened with powdered brown sugar which also gives it a unique taste. One Mexican community is celebrated for having the bread-makers who make this product the best. The recipes which they use have passed from generation to generation and it is more than a business for them - it is a tradition worthy of pride.
Fermina is a member of the La Espiga group, the name of which makes reference to the plant which provides the grain which eventually becomes flour: the raw material for their activity, breadmaking. She is a tireless woman, who is prepared to work ferociously for her children, who are studying.
"Now I am the third generation in charge of the business and my children are also learning to make traditional bread", says Fermina, who has been in charge of the bakery for twelve years. From when she was young, she observed her parents going out to sell their products at festivals, conventions and parties in one community or another. To begin with they cooked with firewood, but now they have gas ovens and shops which are adapted to their business. Being originally from the region where they make the best 'pan de fiesta', there is lots of competition but far from worrying about that, she works to improve the quality and taste of her products all the time so that her customers continue to want to buy it.
With the money from the loan, she will buy flour, yeast, sugar, etc. which are the ingredients which she uses the most. It is worth mentioning that she is very happy and motivated because every investment made is reflected in the attractive earnings which she obtains. One of her dreams is to open another business to provide education for her children. "My daughter wants to study for a career with computers and I want her dreams to become a reality", Fermina says happily.
The other members of the group are Francisca, Cristina and Magdalena who, in the same way, will invest in raw materials to make bread.
**The photograph was taken on the steps of the town pavillion. Fermina is the one wearing a green jacket.

loans.use: to buy yeast, flour, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en:
Pablo is an artisan from Guatemala who specializes in handcrafted jade and sterling silver jewelry. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and jade for his designs.

Pablo has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is his story:

"I've cultivated my artisan dreams since I was a boy. My first piece of traditional silverwork was a Maya design bracelet with quetzal birds, crafted when I was 11. I am very grateful to show my work here, taking a little bit of everything that Guatemala is beyond our borders, and being able to live from the work I enjoy – silver crafts. Today I dream of being able to leave my daughter an art that has been in our family for several generations."

"Heartfelt thanks for your support through this microcredit. We are preparing for the holiday rush and are hopeful that it will be a good year for sales. Thanks for helping our workshop continue to grow."

Use the link below to view Pablo's handcrafted jade and sterling silver jewelry on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/7987

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and jade for his designs

loans.name: Lucky Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Aminata who is 41 years old was unanimously appointed to lead the group because of her wealth of experience in managing people. She is married with three children. Her children are all school going children. Aminata belongs to a solidarity group of three women, who have come together to complement each other achieve their individual dreams. “Lucky” is the name of Aminata’s solidarity group. “Lucky” group needs a total loan of 10,500,000SLL of which Aminata will receive 1,500,000SLL in order to purchase 5 cartons foam soap, 10 crates of soft drinks for her business.

Aminata trades in mix items in a rented shop right in the city centre of Freetown. Her business which has been in existence for over ten years is the main source of her livelihood and that of her family and supports her children’s education. She opens her business Monday through Saturday every week from 7 am to 6 pm. Aminata is a hardworking woman, See Aminata n the middle of the group picture.

In the future, Aminata plans to support her children to acquire university education. She hopes that one day her will become an international business woman. She will be very appreciative to anyone that can help. She thanks you for supporting them.

loans.use: to purchase 5 cartons foaming soap, 10 crates of soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Razel

texts.en:
Razel is 24 years old and has three children. Razel is married and her three children are presently in school.

Razel is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Razel requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pig.

Razel has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Soedesh

texts.en: Soedesh feels very good and thanks all his Kiva lenders for helping him with his rice production. He has repaid his loan fully and with the profits he could pay for the tuition of his children. Soedesh wants to save more for his family and give them a bright future. For this, he needs to continue with the rice production and for the purchase of inputs he needs another loan of SRD 7.000.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides for his rice cultivation.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 54 years old and is engaged in a fish-vending business. She recalls that she wouldn't be where she is now without the financial assistance Paglaum MPC extended to a small-time borrower like her.

She has been a member of the cooperative since 2005 and has availed herself of various loan products, including life insurance. Recently, she took a loan to pay for her insurance premium.

loans.use: to pay for her insurance premium

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita finds pleasure in doing her farming activities. Not only is she doing her hobby, she earns an income as well. At the age of 79 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family.

She grabbed the opportunity to become a full-fledged member of PMPC. She credits to the cooperative her capital in supporting her gardening activities.

Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for land preparation like plowing and harrowing and to purchase of a good variety of seedlings for healthier, heavier, and more produce.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation like plowing and harrowing and to purchase a good variety of seedlings for healthier, heavier, and more produce.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion, 69 years old, lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental with her husband and four children. Her husband is a construction worker. Unable to sustain the needs of the family with only her husband’s income, she has found ways to attain income through snack and food vending.

It began with selling a small amount of viands and snacks to their neighbors. She joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari (small grocery) store in January of 2011. She became a microfinance member, which is why she has received loans several times already.

Now, she applied for 10,000 PHP to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store. She hopes that her business will continue and someday become a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 43 years old and has five children. Teresita is married, and one of her children is still in school.

Teresita is in the agricultural business of farming rice in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Teresita has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lucille

texts.en:
Lucille is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lucille is 26 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Lucille has a buying and selling of mineral water business in the Philippines. Lucille requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of mineral water to sell.

Lucille has been in this business for one year. In the future, Lucille would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of mineral water to sell

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina lives in Xochimilco with her husband and son. She works selling vegetable and fruit in a stand that moves around each day of the week. Angelina knows her house needs a lot of work to call finally call it home, however she feels that right now the most important things are building an outside wall to keep intruders away and protect her property and finishing the bathroom that they are not able to use at this moments.

She has an informal job and no credit history, so accessing credit from other institutions is nearly impossible. Angelina wishes this is the first of many opportunities she gets to have access to financial tools that can help her continue doing improvements to her home. Angelina´s husband is a construction worker and will do all the work. He will also receive technical supervision and visits from certified technicians that will assist in the process.

loans.use: to keep her family safe by building a wall and finish the family bathroom.

loans.name: Akmaljon

texts.en:
Akmaljon is a bright boy. He was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1997 and is living in a rural area with his parents. He is single and a freshmen student. This year he graduated from his secondary school and entered university to get a higher education.

He studies at Metallurgic University at Mechanical Technology specialty – full time department. He wants to be professional and work in Tajikistan to support homeland production. He wishes Kiva lenders will support him to pay his education costs. The loan will help him to have a chance to be educated at higher education institute and find a good job to help his country.

loans.use: to help pay for a BSc. in Mechanical Technology and then find a good job to help his country

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 31 years old. She is married and a mother of three children. Her business is a retail shop. She has been in this business for 13 years.
She earns a monthly income of twenty-five thousand shillings. This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy stock of sugar, salt sodas, cooking oil, soap etc. for sale in the shop.

She will use the profits from expanded business to educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to have a stable family and a prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy stock of sugar, salt sodas, cooking oil, soap etc. for sale in the shop.

loans.name: Marefel

texts.en: Marefel is 30 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with one school-age child. For the last five years, she has earned a living by managing a car-radiator repair shop with her husband as repairman. They earn about PHP 4,000 a month from their work. Marefel has requested a loan to buy more materials and supplies for the shop. She has been a member of PMPC for five years and hopes to expand the shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a car-radiator business.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a married woman with three children, two of whom attends school. She owns a house that neither  has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Virginia is 58 years old and has one child still in school.

Virginia has an herbal medicine business in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more bottles of herbal medicine to sell.

Virginia has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bottles of herbal medicine to sell.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima is 25-year-old single lady, who is working hard to prepare herself to get married soon. She is employed in a shoes shop, but her limited monthly salary stops her from doing several things she seeks to have.

Rima is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy a living room set and start preparing her wedding needs preparations.
She has six years of experience in this domain, and she is looking forward to open her own business in the future.

loans.use: To buy a living room set and start preparing her wedding needs preparations.

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es: Maria de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas, ella se dedica a la confección de ropa, tiene ya más de 15 años de experiencia en el negocio, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades de su hogar, Maria esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas tela, hilos, agujas, botones, etc. para continuar con su trabajo ya que le ha ido muy bien en sus ganancias y asi darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria is 47 years old. She lives in her own home with her two daughters. She works as a seamstress, she has over 15 years in this business and this work has helped her cover the needs of her household. Maria is again asking for a loan to buy more fabric, threads, needles, buttons, etc. to continue with her work because it has gone very well and she has been able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy more fabric, needles, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Farrukh

texts.en: Farrukh is an attentive father who was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1974. He now lives in remote district with his wife and three children. He has worked with livestock since childhood and is skill;ed at raising them. After graduating from high school, he entered university and finished his studies with excellence. He and his wife work hard to support their family, but their standard of living is poor. Farrukh's goal is to save money and build a house. His son helps him at work and participated in a world sport championship and won first place. Farrukh helped his son pay to go to the event, and is requesting this loan to help pay for his tuition.

loans.use: to pay his son’s tuition.

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina is 72 years old. She is a pensioner member of Paglaum MPC. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the co-op offers. She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which she applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks.

She hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given a priority, as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what she is thankful for, when all the financing needs of her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a microfinance member of PMPC. She is 27 years old, married, and has a snack-vending business in Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. This is how she supports her family, with a meager income of PHP 5,000 per month.

Recently, she took out a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. She wants to improve her family's living conditions and maintain her membership with the Cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en: Elenita is married, 47 years old, and the mother of four children, three of whom attend school. She earns a living by running a food-vending business in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 6,000 loan from NWTF to buy ingredients such as vegetables, meat, fish, and spices. Elenita has been in this business for ten years and would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-selling business.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en:
Primitiva has started her small-time business and become a boss with her sari-sari store. She has managed to have enough inventory and rolls up her capital to gain more profit. Everyday she has made good sales since she is the only store in their barangay.

Recently, she approached Paglaum for much needed capital to restock her store with basic commodities. In the future, she hopes to make a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Jefferson

texts.en: Jefferson is a hardworking father who is committed to meet the needs of his family. He is 45 years old, married and has once school-age child. He joined Paglaum MPC to obtain needed capital for his food-vending business. He has local customers, most of whom are students.

loans.use: to buy more meat and spices for his food-vending business.

loans.name: Hermesia

texts.en:
Hermesia has switched from selling snacks to selling prepared foods (viands). Her business is doing well when she doubles her time perfecting her own recipe.

With her husband's help, she has maximized her profits and keeps pursuing her goals for the good of her family. She availed herself of another loan from PMPC to buy more kilos of meat for her food vending business.

loans.use: to buy more kilos of meat for her food vending business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria has a collection of ornamental garden plants. She finds pleasure in doing her gardening business and earns an income as well for her family. As a Microfinance member of PMPC, she has sought financial help to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell.

In the future, Gloria wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell.

loans.name: Citlali Daniela

texts.es:
A Citlali siempre le atrajo la moda, las prendas y la elegancia con unos pequeños detalles. Razón por la cual hace cuatro años decidió comenzar a vender joyas de plata y de acero con la ayuda de su esposo. Ahora a sus 26 años de edad, esta emprendedora no solo hace algo a fin de lo que le apasiona, sino también algo que le ayudará a asegurar el futuro de su pequeño de cinco años de edad. 
Afortunadamente, Citlali cuenta con el apoyo moral y económico de su esposo, por lo que le atrae la idea de invertir en este. Por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar aretes, pulseras, collares, anillos, entre otras joyas que estén a la vanguardia y le permitan incrementar su clientela y, por supuesto, sus ingresos.  En sus planes está establecer su propio local, puesto que ahora solo lo hace de forma ambulante.
texts.en:
Citali has always been attracted to fashion, clothes and elegance in the small details. This is the reason why, four years ago, she decided to start selling silver and steel jewellery with the help of her husband. Now, aged 26, this enterprising woman is not only doing something she is passionate about, but something that will also help to secure the future of her five-year-old son.

Fortunately, Citali has the moral and financial support of her husband, so she likes the idea of investing in her business. This is why she is asking for a loan to buy earrings, bracelets, necklaces, rings and other jewellery that is in fashion which will allow her to increase her clientele and, of course, her income. Her plan is to establish her own shop, as at the moment she only sells her products in the streets.

loans.use: to buy earrings, bracelets, necklaces, rings and other jewellery.

loans.name: Baghagha Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 20 juin 2002. Ce groupe est composé de vingt femmes qui exercent le commerce. Madame Sira qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 55 ans et mère de trois enfants dont deux filles. Elle s'active depuis plus de quinze années dans la vente de crevette et de poisson séché. Elle va acheter deux cartons de crevettes et un panier de poisson séché. Elle maitrise très bien son activité. Les bénéfices vont servir à aider à la prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
This village loan association was inaugurated on June 20, 2002. This group is composed of twenty women who are engaged in small-scale retailing. Madame Sira, who is on the right in the photo, raising her hand, is the representative of the group. She is married, aged 55, and the mother of three children, two of them daughters.

Madame Sira has been selling shrimp and dried fish for more than 15 years. She is going to buy two cartons of shrimp and a basket of dried fish. She is very skilled at her business. The profits will be used to help with covering the needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy sea food and dried fish.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur, 41 years old, and her four children are in school.

Esterlita has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishnets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Esterlita has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishnets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Dúo Dios Es Luz Group

texts.es:
Dúo Dios es Luz

Este dúo está integrado por Telma ella es originario de Sumpango, es soltera, ella se dedica a la venta verduras y tejidos tipicos, desde ya hace mucho tiempo, cuenta que tiene mucha competencia pero eso no le impide seguir trabajando para mejorar su vida, por lo que necesitas un crédito para poder comprar verduras y materia prima para la elaboración de tejidos tipicos ya que el sueño que ella tiene es de variar los colores que ella ofrece en tejidos, ella desde ya agradece a kiva por la ayuda que le brindara ya que es el primer crédito que solicita.
texts.en:
Dios es Luz Duo

Telma is part of this duo. She is originally from Sumpango. She is single, and she has been selling vegetables and typical textiles for a long time now. She is very good at it, but that doesn't stop her from continuing to work to better her life, which is why she needs a loan to buy vegetables and raw materials to create the typical textiles.

Her dream is to vary the colors of the textiles that she offers. She is grateful to Kiva for the help that it will offer her, since this is the first loan she has requested.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and the raw materials for making typical textiles.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 23 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se deduca a la venta de ropa de cama y perfumes desde hace algunos años, vende de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas mercaderia por mayor para poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
The young lady whose face is pixelated as she is 23 years old and lives in a high-risk area, has earned her living selling bed linen and perfumes for several years. She sells her different perfumes in the street and with what she makes from her sales she has managed to take care of some home expenses.

The young lady lives in her own home with her family. She is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise wholesale so that she can have a better financial income.

loans.use: to buy bed linen and perfumes.

loans.name: Zarifa

texts.en:
Zarifa is a 51-year-old married lady, who has been working in Mouneh production and sales from her house since 1995. Mouneh are traditional Lebanese pickled vegetables. She is a hard working lady who puts so much effort on developing her business and family's social and financial living.

Zarifa supports her husband in making their living. Through the acquired loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, Zarifa is going to buy necessary raw materials to increase her Mouneh production before the coming Autumn and winter seasons.
She might also buy a living room set for her house to improve their home's situation.

Zarifa is working hard to stay capable of developing her family's living and business at the same time in a well managed way.

loans.use: to buy necessary raw materials to increase her Mouneh (traditonal Lebanese pickles) production before the coming Autumn and winter seasons.

loans.name: Grupo Barrio El Capulín Group

texts.es:
El grupo Barrio el Capulín está integrado por personas amables y trabajadoras originarias de una comunidad con raíces de la cultura mazahua. La mayoría de los habitantes se dedica al cultivo de maíz y la cría de animales de corral. Cabe destacar que esta es la mejor temporada para apreciar el panorama de la región pues la primavera resalta la belleza y colorido de sus campos. 
   Doña Cecilia es una mujer muy trabajadora quien siempre se encuentra sonriendo pues es su manera  de sentirse bien y hacer sentirse a los que la rodean. Vive casada con el señor José quien trabaja como albañil y juntos formaron una familia integrada por tres hijos de los cuales dos dependen de dicha pareja. Mientras José se gana la vida trabajando como albañil, Doña Ceci, como le dicen de cariño, hace lo propio con la cría de ovejas. Tiene veinte años como criadora  y la calidad que brinda a sus clientes respalda su trabajo; es un negocio que además le permite atender a sus hijos y obtener ganancias para sus estudios.
   Su rutina empieza desde muy temprano cuando saca al campo a sus ovejas para que se alimenten. “Cuando iniciamos con nuestro negocio solo teníamos tres ovejitas y gracias a los créditos con VF México hemos llegado tener hasta diez al mismo tiempo” comentó muy contenta Doña Ceci. Una vez que los animales encuentran su peso ideal los vende con los cocineros de barbacoa quienes realizan un platillo único en la región. Uno de sus es remodelar su vivienda y que sus hijos puedan terminar una carrera profesional para que así tengan una mejor calidad de vida.
   Los integrantes del grupo son  Elizabeth, Edelia, Lucero, y Maria quienes invertirán en la compra de ovejas; Benito, en guajolotes y Guadalupe, en una tienda de abarrotes.
*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del quiosco del municipio, Doña Ceci es quien viste el suéter azul.
texts.en:
The "Barrio de Capulin" group consists of friendly and hard-working people from a community with their roots in the Mazahua culture. The majority of the inhabitants grow corn and raise barnyard animals. It's worthy to note that this is the best season to appreciate the panorama of the region as spring brings out the beauty and colors of the countryside.

Cecilia is a hard-working woman who is always smiling as it is her way of feeling good and making those around her feel good. She lives with her husband José who works as a bricklayer and together they form a family with their three children, two of whom are dependent on them. While José makes his living as a bricklayer, Ceci as she is called with affection, makes her own money raising sheep. She has raised sheep for 20 years and the quality that she provides her customers backs up her work. Plus it is a business that allows her to take care of her children while making income for their studies.

Her routine starts very early when she takes the sheep out to pasture. "When we started our business, we only had three sheep and thanks to the loans from VF México we have gotten up to ten at a time," Ceci very contently explained. Once the animals reach their ideal weight she sells them to the barbecue businesses who make a dish unique to the region. One of her dreams is to remodel her house and she wants her children to complete study to be professionals so that they have a good quality of living.

The members of the group are: Elizabeth, Edelia, Lucero, and Maria who will invest buying sheep; Benito, in turkeys y Guadalupe in her grocery store..

*The photograph was taken on the steps of the municipal kiosk. Ceci is wearing the blue sweater.

loans.use: to buy three lambs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy mutton

loans.name: Mumbi

texts.en:
Mumbi is 58 years old. She is married and has 2 children. 

Her business is farming and livestock keeping. She has been in this business for 15 years. 

She earns a monthly income of fifteen thousand shillings. This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya. 

She will use the loan to buy farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer. 

She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to have a big business and a happy family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is 40 years old. He is married and has 2 children. 

His business is farming. He has been in this business for 11 years. 

He earns a monthly income of twenty five thousand Kenya shillings. 

This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya. 

He will use the loan  He will use the profits from expanded business to educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to have a healthy family and educated children.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Minerva works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming seaweeds. Minerva is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Minerva has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attends school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a butcher shop business for the past one year, selling meat goat. She faces a major challenge of transportaion in her business.
With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock goats to slaughter and get meat for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock goats to slaughter and get meat for resale.

loans.name: Satou's Group

texts.fr:
Créé depuis le 10 Décembre 2009, les femmes du B.V sont  très solidaires entre elles et ont su par le travail d’ensemble développer une solidarité et un esprit de groupe salué. Elles ont comme activité principale le  petit commerce.

Madame Satou (assise à l’extrême gauche avec une main levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette. Elle est mariée, âgée de 44 ans et mère de 6 enfants dont 4 garçons s et 2 filles. Elle est vendeuse de glace et de jus dans le quartier.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter des sachets d’une valeur de 2500f et payer sa facture d’électricité à 50000f  tous les 2 mois et celle de l’eau à 10000f, acheter de l’oseille et du sucre d’un montant de 30000f pour les besoins du jus  pour les revendre en détail.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle compte augmenter son épargne et aider son mari dans la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Created on December 10, 2009, this village association's members are devoted to each other and through working together have been able to develop solidarity and a commendable group spirit. Their principal activity is small-scale retailing.

Madame Satou (seated at the far left with one hand raised) is the featured borrower. She is married, aged 44, and the mother of six children, four sons and two daughters. She sells ice and juice in the neighborhood.

With her new loan, she intends to buy small plastic bags for the amount of 2,500 francs and pay her electricity bill which amounts to 50,000 francs every other month. She will pay the water bill in the amount of 10,000 francs, and buy dried hibiscus flowers and sugar for 30,000 francs. The latter are the ingredients for the juice she makes and sells retail.

With her profit, she intends to grow her savings and help her husband with the children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy small plastic bags for the amount of 2,500 francs and pay her electricity bill which amounts to 50,000 francs every other month; also pay the water bill in the amount of 10,000 francs, and buy dried hibiscus flowers and sugar for 30,000 francs.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz heads up for the next cropping season. She wants to prepare well, especially the much needed land and seedbed preparations.

She wants to have enough supply of corn fertilizer, for which she applied for a loan from the Cooperative. Beatriz hopes to save enough for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy corn fertilizer for more produce.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Berta Alicia

texts.es: Berta de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 9 años, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Berta is 36 years old and lives in her own home with her life partner. She has had a small shop located in her home for the last 9 years. She has a lot of clients because of her good prices and kindness when it comes to selling. She is asking for a loan to be able to buy more soups, eggs, staple grains, soft drinks, sweets, sweet bread and other items, so that she can have a better income to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, staple grains, soft drinks, sweets, sweet bread and other items.

loans.name: Ansatou Djide's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois a été créé le 06 Décembre 2010 lors l’inauguration du dit banc villageois. Il est composé de femmes qui jouissent d’une bonne entente et d’un bon esprit de groupe. Elles  ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Ansatou Djidé (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du  groupe. Elle est âgée de 37 ans, mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle est vendeuse de produits alimentaires. 

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter du poisson fumé d’un montant de 2000f de l’huile de palme d’un montant de 25000f et d’autres condiments pour le revendre en détails chez elle. 

Les bénéfices réalisés, lui permettront de prendre en charge les besoins en habillement, nourriture, soins médicaux et scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This loan group was created at the inauguration of the village loan association on December 6, 2010. The loan group is composed of women who enjoy good relations with each other and a good group spirit. Their principal activity is small-scale commerce.

Madame Ansatou Djidé (standing on the far right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower for the group. She is 37 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She sells foodstuffs.

Her new loan will permit her to buy smoked fish for the amount of 2,000 francs, palm oil for 25,000 francs, and other condiments to retail out of her house. The profits she will make will allow her to take responsibility for her children's expenses in clothing, food, healthcare, and education.
.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish for the amount of 2,000 francs, palm oil for 25,000 francs, and other condiments to retail out of her home.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy supplies to make tortillas for sale.

loans.name: Dominga Esperanza

texts.es: Dominga de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 15 años su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas ingredientes como: maiz, aceite, carnes, pollos, verduras, frutas, etc. y asi poder obtener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: 33-year-old Dominga lives in her own home with her husband. She has worked selling food for 15 years. Her business is located in her home and she has a lot of customers. She is able to cover some of her household expenses with her earnings. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as corn, oil, meat, chickens, vegetables, fruits, etc., which will allow her to obtain a higher income.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as corn, oil, meat, chickens, vegetables, fruits, etc.

loans.name: Las Cochitas Group

texts.es:
La comunidad donde se ubica el grupo Las Conchitas se puede definir como un lugar pequeño, tranquilo y lleno de personas muy alegres y trabajadoras. Gran parte de esta población se dedica a la cría de animales como pollos, ovejas, reses, y “guajolotes” que es el nombre tradicional con el que llaman al pavo. De igual manera se dedican a la agricultura ya que tienen grandes extensiones de tierra en donde cultivan principalmente maíz.
   Doña Guadalupe es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, todas las vecinas de su comunidad la conocen simplemente como Lupita. Vive felizmente desde hace 38 años con su pareja Hilario y aunque tienen hijos ya todos son independientes. Por otro lado, tiene una tienda de abarrotes que ha mantenido durante 34 años. Esta vez ha solicitado el crédito para reabastecer su negocio al comprar pan, leche, huevo, refrescos, harina, golosinas, etc. Algunas veces le cuesta trabajo abastecer su negocio por la falta de dinero y siempre tenía dificultades en conseguir un crédito. Al día de hoy tiene la esperanza de recuperar todas las ganancias que obtenía anteriormente debido a que sus competidores gradualmente han ido disminuyendo. "Yo estoy muy contenta por el préstamo ofrecido por parte de VF México y KIVA ya que esto será de gran ayuda para crecer en mi actividad" comentó Doña Lupita.
   Los demás integrantes del grupo son Valentina quien invertirá en ovejas; Beatriz, en periódico; Manuela, en pollos; Florencia, en una carpintería; Fermín en aves de corral y Hermenegildo, en caballos.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el pequeño jardín del municipio, Doña Lupita es quien viste el mandil rosa.
texts.en:
The community in which the Las Cochitas group lives can be called a small place. It is peaceful and full of very happy and hard-working people. A large part of the population raises animals such as chickens, sheep, cattle and "guajolotes", which is the traditional name for turkey. They also are involved in farming, since they have large plots of land where they grow mainly corn.

Doña Guadalupe is a very pleasant and hard-working woman. All of her neighbors in the community simply know her as Lupita. She has lived happily with her partner Hilario for 38 years, and though they have children, they're all on their own now. In addition, she has run a small grocery store for 34 years. Now she is seeking a loan to restock her business, buying bread, milk, eggs, refreshments, flour, treats, etc.

Sometimes it is hard for her to stock her business due to a lack of money, and she has always had a hard time obtaining a loan. Currently she hopes to recover the level of earnings that she used to have, since her competition has gradually been decreasing. Doña Lupita comments, "I am very pleased with the loan that is being offered by VF México and Kiva, since this will be of great help to me for growing in my work:"

The other members of the group are Valentina, who will invest in sheep, Beatriz, in newspapers, Manuela, in chickens, Florencia, in a carpentry shop, Fermín in poultry, and Hermenegildo, in horses.

*The photograph was taken in a small garden in the municipality. Doña Lupita is the one in the pink apron.

loans.use: to buy milk, bread, eggs, refreshments, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. As a farmer in Pagadian City, she tried her luck and borrowed a loan to jump-start her corn production. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Lilia feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her business.

Recently, she availed herself of a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Lilia wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply corn in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Gaudioso

texts.en:
Gaudioso has considerably prepared for the post-harvest operations of his corn in Calamba. He wants to ensure that he will have ample time for the harvesting, drying, storage, and processing of his harvest to make way for another cropping season.

He presented his proposal to Paglaum MPC and made a loan request. Gaudioso hopes to see all his children finish their degrees and have stable careers.

loans.use: to pay for post-harvest operations.

loans.name: Zeina

texts.en:
Zeina, a 26 years old married mother of two children, who works hard for five years in the agriculture business, specialized in planting and selling white broad beans, thyme and Mulukhiyah. Zeina supports her husband in everything they might need.

She is working hard to develop her sales area, so she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy a car necessary to facilitate her production distribution and transportation.

Zeina is planing for a future business development, where at the same time she will make sure that this car will also help her husband in facilitating his plumbing services he provides.

loans.use: to buy a car necessary to facilitate her production distribution and transportation.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 56 years old. She is widowed and has three children. Her business is farming. She has been in this business for 20 years. She earns a monthly income of fifteen thousand shillings. This is her 3rd loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds. She will use the profits from expanded business to boost her business to improve the standard of living of her family. Her hopes and dreams are to have a big business and a family with a good standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Deogracias

texts.en:
Deogracias is a retired government employee who is supported by his monthly pension and allotment from his children. He is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance.

Recently, he applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. He is on his way to renovating his house. He wishes to live comfortably with his family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks.

loans.name: Elona

texts.en:
Elona, 49, is separated with two adult-aged children.

Elona's major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 13 years already. The business helped her to meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children until they graduated and got jobs. Elona is still continuing the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. Someday she will have a legacy to leave to her children.

Elona's plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. She already availed loans previously to purchase additional stock, and now she is applying again for a loan for her store.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 43 years old. He is married and has 4 children. 

His business is farming and selling passion fruits. He has been in this business for 10 years. He earns a monthly income of ten thousand Kenya shillings. 

This is his second loan with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and supporting poles and strings for passions stalks to climb on. 

He will use the profits from expanded business to educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to be financially stable

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supporting poles and strings for passions stalks to climb on.

loans.name: Mylyn

texts.en:
Mylyn is 33 years old and a member of CCT General Trias branch. She is married to Nicanor and has one child who is still in the Elementary level in school. She has been a jeepney operator for seven years already and it has helped fund her family's daily sustenance. 

In the Philippines, jeepneys, which were originally in American military service during World War two, have been converted into a transportation vehicle by making them two meters longer and putting two long upholstered seats in them. Since then thru have 
become the most common and cheapest form of public transportation. 

A regular and proper maintenance of her vehicle is necessary to ensure efficient performance and steady income. In view of this, Mylyn is humbly requesting a PHP 25,000 loan to pay for spare parts like tires and regular maintenance to avoid breakdowns .She hopes for a positive response on her request. This will assure her of regular earnings to support her family's daily personal and household needs.

Mylyn hopes to acquire a new jeepney to lessen the maintenance cost. She also prays for abundance in their lives. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinsnce loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and for the maintenance of her jeepney.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 28 years old. She is married and has 5 children. 

Her business is a retail shop and farming. She has been in this business for 3 years. She earns a monthly income of twenty one thousand Kenya shillings. 

This is her 4th loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy stock sugar, salt, soap, maize flour, milk, rice, tissue papers, paraffin etc. 

She will use the profits from expanded business to educate her children and also service the loan. 

Her hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy stock sugar, salt, soap, maize flour, milk, rice, tissue papers, paraffin etc.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa manages her eatery business in Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. The business has been doing well, supporting the needs of the family. Theresa has local customers and also accepts catering orders for added income.

Recently, she took a loan to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery. She wants to expand her business and would be more happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery.

loans.name: Yoxaja 6 Group

texts.es:
Cristina es una madre de familia de 37 años de edad, es casada con una familia de cuatro hijos de las edades entre 6 y 18 años de edad, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad del caserío Yoxaja.
Cristina (la primera del lado izquierdo de la fotografía) para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, desde hace 15 años ella eligió  una actividad que le genere ingresos y su actividad económica es el cultivo y venta de café, ella le encanta esta labor porque lo realiza desde los lugares cercanos de su hogar. Cristina en estos momentos tiene un inconveniente con el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café, por esa razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra, para conseguir en esta temporada una buena cosecha. 
Su más gran anhelo es conseguir el crédito que lo ayudara para el cultivo de café e incrementar su cultivo en los próximos años.
texts.en:
Cristina is a 37 year old married mother with a family of four children between 6 and 18 years old. This humble family lives in the small village of Yoxaja.

Cristina (first on the left in the picture) helps her husband with the household expenses by growing and selling coffee. She started this 15 years ago as a way of earning income and she loves this job as the locations where she works are close to her home.

Cristina currently has a problem maintaining her coffee business and for that reason she is applying for a loan in order to buy fertilizers and pay workers so that she can have a good harvest this season.

Her greatest hope is that she gets the loan which will help her coffee business and increase her crops in the coming years.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay workers.

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma is a working wife and the mother of three children, and lives in a area of Lahore, Pakistan. Uzma is a very creative lady and she had a dream of becoming a beautician. She chased her dreams and became an expert in the field.

Her salon is a source of a good income for her household finances. She is really proud of herself, and proud of her employees for working so hard with her as a team.

Uzma applied for this loan to get a boost in her business and also to upgrade her standards in order to increase demand and to bring home even more profit, so that she can make her children's dreams come true, becoming a contributing citizen to the country's economy. Uzma is pleased with the Kiva loan routine, and will be capable of repaying it on time. She is thankful to the Kiva team and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and equipment for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Condrada

texts.en:
Condrada is 66 years old, and a widow with two adult-age children. She lives in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur and is a pensioner member of Paglaum MPC.

Condrada is grateful of the services the cooperative offers to members like her, including insurance and health programs. Recently, she obtained a loan to pay for a medical check-up and to purchase maintenance medicines.

loans.use: to pay for a medical check-up and to purchase maintenance medicines.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.en:
Fortunata, who is 53 years old, lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, with her husband and two children. Her husband is a construction worker.

Unable to sustain the needs of the family with only her husband’s income, Fortunata has found ways to attain income through snack and food vending. It began with selling a small amount of viands and snacks to their neighbours. She joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari (small grocery) store in January of 2004. She became a microfinance member, which is why she has received loans several times already.

Now, Fortunata is applying for 12,000 PHP to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store. She hopes that her business will continue and someday become a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es: Doña Paula de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella se dedica a la crianza de gallinas desde hace 28 años vende sus productos durante todo el año y con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas gallinas para la crianza y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Paula is 52 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband and daughter. She has made a living breeding chickens for the last 28 years. She sells her products year-round and manages to cover some household expenses with her profits.

She is requesting a loan to buy more chickens for breeding so as to have better income.

loans.use: to buy more chickens.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita finds pleasure doing her gardening activities. Not only is she doing her hobby, she earns an income as well.

At the age of 62 and married, Clarita busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full-fledged member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative for her capital in supporting her gardening activities.

Recently, Clarita applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ronna

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Ronna works hard to support her family.

Ronna has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store. Ronna is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as vegetables, spices, etc.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Ronna has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as vegetables, spices, etc.

loans.name: Mayra Francisca
