Godofreda is requesting her 10th loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used  for the expansion of her existing business. She wants to buy more kilos of fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: Esterlita is 56 years old and married with 4 adult age children. She has been a wholesaler of bananas for almost 22 years. From this extensive experience in selling, she already has intricate knowledge in this kind of business. Even though there are many competitors in town, Esterlita still gets more customers than the rest due to her good salesmanship and character. She has been successful over the years and has managed to save some money for her family. For now, Esterlita is planning to buy a parcel of land in order for her to manage a new business which is creating a small pigpen for additional income in the near future. To fund this project, she needs additional capital to purchase 100 kilos of bananas, so she has requested a loan from Paglaum-MPC.

loans.use: to purchase 100 kilos of wholesale bananas

loans.name: Maximiliano

texts.en: In 2014, Maximiliano learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives to start-ups. Maximiliano tried his luck on doing a business focusing on his farming activities. He feels he owes his profits to the Cooperative for having trusted him with the money he used as capital. Now, Maximiliano is taking our another loan to pay for seedlings and compost. This will increase his farming income. Maximiliano looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha came to the right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet when she was broke after her first business failed. PMPC offered services to Editha that came as a rescue by lending her money when she needed it the most. Now, she has availed another loan for the next crop season. This time she borrowed for land and seedbed preparation.  Editha perseveres and always believed that she will reach her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Kokou Amedjimele

texts.fr: Kokou est un jeune célibataire sans enfant âgée de 25 ans qui vit à Tokoin. Kokou est un marchand de friperies qui s’approvisionne au marché et le revend à domicile et dans les quartiers environnant. Kokou nécessite ce prêt pour commander des unités d’habits afin de répondre aux attentes de ses clients et gagner une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour subvenir à ses besoins et à  aider sa famille.
texts.en: Kokou is a 25 year old single man without children, living in Tokoin. Kokou sells secondhand clothing which he buys in the market and then sells from home and in the neighbouring area. Kokou needs this loan to buy some dresses in order to meet the needs of his customers, and to earn a good profit margin to cover his living costs and to help his family.

loans.use: to buy fifteen dresses.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 31 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Francisca works very hard to provide for them.

Francisca runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, snack foods, home products, and other groceries.

Francisca has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Francisca would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, snack foods, home products, and other groceries

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme mariée résidant à Tokoin avec trois enfants à charge. Afi est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Pour financer son achat, Afi  nécessite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois afin de réaliser plus de bénéfice et soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille puis permettre une bonne éducation à leurs enfants.
texts.en: Afi is a married woman living in Tokoin with three dependent children. She sells charcoal which she buys twice a month in the market and resells from the front of her home. To finance her purchase, Afi needs this loan to order the sacks of charcoal. Thus she can make more profit and help her husband with the family's living expenses, and also enable their children to have a good education.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Salud

texts.en:
Salud has wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, tending and harvesting, as well as earning income. Salud has supported her husband doing this type of work.

While working as a farmer, Salud has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knew she could always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs.

Recently she has applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds which will have good results and produce healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

One day Salud hopes to purchase another rice field to cultivate which will potentially increase income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds that will have good results and produce healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings

loans.name: Estilito

texts.en:
Estilito is a businessman from Molave with sales expertise. He is 44 years old and married. He runs a little sari-sari store and earns a low income that sufficiently supports his family.

He is a fully fledged member of PMPC and has taken out several loans already. He maintains his membership in good standing without records of default. Now he has applied for a loan to restock his store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

Estilito continues to look for better business opportunities - proof that he has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for his family.

loans.use: to restock his store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Julie Peace

texts.en:
Julie Peace is married with 2 school-aged kids.

She and her husband till and cultivate their own rice paddy field that primarily provides for the needs of their family.

While working as a farmer, Julie Peace has nurtured her membership with Paglaum MPC and she has no records of delayed payments. Recently, she has taken out her 5th loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase bags of fertilizer for her rice paddy field.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer for her rice paddy field.

loans.name: Liby

texts.en:
Liby is managing his eatery business which is located at a public market of Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. He mastered the business when he and his wife were in the early years of their marriage. This has been doing well supporting the needs of the family.

He has local customers and will also accept catering for added income.

Recently, he borrowed an amount to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for his eatery business.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for his eatery business.

loans.name: Chellome

texts.en: Chellome is 35 years old. She is known in Pines, Oroquieta City, for her RTW sales and motor transport business. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the coop offers. She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which she applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and boards. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given a priority, as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). She is thankful that all her financing needs of her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and boards for her house.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is a hardworking woman who is engaged in the raising of hogs in her village. She is still single, and mostly spending her time in caring for her nieces and nephews.

Adelina wants to maintain her business in order to extend her financial support to her relatives as well. For this, Adelina is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy piglets to raise. She will also use the loan to buy feed for the sustenance of her hogs.

Adelina will use the loan wisely, manage her business well to maintain it and have a continuous source of income to be able to extend her support to her relatives.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Paulita

texts.en:
Paulita is 64 years old and widowed with five children. Paulita works very hard to provide for them.

Paulita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Paulita has been in this business for 23 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Paulita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita is 41 years old and and married. She has five children, two of whom are in school.

Marita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock. She has been raising pigs for 9 years now and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Teofista

texts.en:
Teofista is 63 years old and married with seven children. With five children in school, Teofista works very hard to provide for them.

Teofista runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

Teofista has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Teofista would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es una mujer de 29 años de edad, es casada con una familia muy unida para la prosperidad. Antonia cuenta que con la ayuda del crédito logro realizar la compra de más mercaderías de zapatos y ahora su negocio ha mejorado mucho, a diferencia de cómo estaba antes, sin embargo ella no se encuentra conforme con este avance, ahora su mayor prioridad es adquirir un terreno donde ella pueda algún día construir o cultivar en ella, acorde a esta necesidad Antonia solicita un nuevo préstamo para la adquisición de media cuerda de terreno.
Antonia tiene las esperanzas puestas en este crédito para hacer posible la compra de este terreno pero también su gran anhelo es que sus hijos sean unos buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Antonia is a 29 year old woman. She is married and has a very united family working for prosperity. Antonia says that with the help of her past loan she managed to buy more footwear merchandise, and now her business has improved a lot, in comparison with how it was before. However, she is not satisfied with this progress. Now her biggest priority is to get a plot of land where she can someday build or farm on. Because of this need, Antonia asks for a new loan to acquire 14 square meters of land. 
Antonia has her hopes set on this loan to make the purchase of this plot of land possible, but also her greatest dream is that her children can be good professionals.

loans.use: to buy 14 square meters of land.

loans.name: Dharmradj

texts.en: Dharmradj thanks all the Kiva lenders for helping him realizing his long term goals. He repaid his loan fully and with the pofits he could save more for his tractor. But that is not enough, so he will continue his rice production and save more. A loan of SRD 10.000 will help dharmradj to buy fertilizers and pesticides so he can continue planting rice.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides so he can expand his rice production business.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is a resident of Concepcion, Iloilo. She is 64 years old, married with five adult children. Her husband works hard as a fisherman while she is engaged in raising pigs business. Her husband raised their children through fishing for almost 30 years. To continue their livelihood, Myrna is asking to lend money to buy feed for her pigs and also fishing net and materials for boat repair. In the future, she wishes to improve her business to have better means of living.

loans.use: to buy feed, fishing net and materials for boat repair

loans.name: Olly &molly Teachers Group

texts.en:
Jovita is a 24-year-old differently abled lady who lives with her husband, parents-in-law and four children, 10 8 6 and 4 years old, in a small village in Lyantonde.

She is engaged in beans, maize and banana cultivation. Her husband is doing the same business. She is also a teacher.

Some years ago, the teachers realised the salary was not enough to meet their financial obligations and also help them to do developmental projects. They decided to form a group to support them in building residential houses and also buy land, cows and goats or other assets that would be buffer in their evening years. or start up businesses to bring additional income. Jovita is the president of this group. She motivated the other group members to form this group so they could help and support each other in their business and personal lives.

Jovita requested a loan of ugx.700,000. She will use her portion to purchase standard quality seeds and organic fertilizers for her maize cultivation. She hopes to build a house for her family and she is very grateful to Kiva for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy seeds and organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is engaged in kitchen ware sales that has been supported by Paglaum MPC. She managed her business well that she makes good sales and also her membership with the cooperative on the basis of her records of payments without default. Recently, she avails her 11th loan to pay for insurance renewal. Emma wants to be sure that she is secured also in terms of life insurance for her family.

loans.use: to pay for insurance renewal

loans.name: Veronica Valesca

texts.es:
Verónica es una mujer de treinta y un años de edad, multifacética, honesta y trabajadora, ella luego de graduarse de la universidad entro a trabajar en una entidad bancaria, siempre ha tenido la vocación de vender, por eso empezó un negocio paralelo a su trabajo, donde vende ropa, perfumes, maquillaje, carteras, billeteras, entre otras cosas. 
Ella ha solicitado un préstamo a Kiva junto a MiCrédito, que le permita comprar carteras de marcas al por mayor, dado que tiene mucha demanda de estas. En un futuro desea poder montar en su casa de habitación una tienda, para poder dedicarse al comercio de forma completa, porque ella siente que esta es su verdadera pasión.
texts.en:
Veronica is 31 years old. She is multi-talented, honest, and hard-working. After graduating from university, she started working at a bank. She has always had a vocation for sales and so started a business alongside her day job. At her business, she sells perfumes, make-up, purses, wallets and other items.

Veronica has applied for a Kiva loan via MiCredito in order to buy branded purses in bulk. She is buying these products as they are very high in demand. In the future, Veronica wants to be able to open a shop in her house in order to work at her business full time. Veronica believes that the business is her true passion.

loans.use: to buy branded purses in bulk.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: Susana tiene 31 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos pequeños, Susana vive en Puebla, ciudad que fue escenario de ciudades prehispánicas como Cantona y Cholula. Susana es una mujer muy proactiva que siempre está pensando en que hacer para mejorar su situación económica. Desde hace 8 años ella puso una papelería que además es un café internet, ella inició este negocio porque quería generar mayores ingresos económicos a su hogar así como volverse independiente, ella con este negocio pretende lograr una situación económica estable, además de poder brindarle a sus hijos pequeños lo mejor, desde luego que sus hijos son su principal motivación. Susana considera que para un emprendedor es muy importante el servicio al cliente así como la atención. Ella solicita un préstamo de MXN 12,000 para poder comprar mercancía en grandes cantidades como: cuadernos, bolígrafos, colores y tener un margen de utilidad más amplio, está muy entusiasmada por este préstamo y asegura que no le fallara a ningún prestamista.
texts.en:
Susana is 31 years old, married and has two young children. She lives in Puebla, a city that set the scene for pre-hispanic cities such as Cantona and Cholula.

Susana is a very pro-active woman who is always thinking about how to improve her financial situation. Eight years ago she opened a stationery shop that also functions as an internet cafe. Susana started this business because she wanted to bring in a higher income for her household and to be independent. Susana plans to use this business in order to be financially more stable and to provide her young children with the best possible life. Of course, Susana's children are her biggest motivation. Susana believes that customer service is very important for entrepreneurs.

Susana is applying for a loan of MXN 12,000 in order to buy merchandise, such as notebooks, pens and colouring pencils, in bulk, and to have a higher profit margin. Susana is very enthusiastic about this loan and promises not to fail any of the lenders.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as notebooks, pens and colouring pencils, in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a headwasher, dyes, bleaches, keratins, hair straightening products, and other finishing products.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a businesswoman from Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old, married and has the expertise in selling. She runs a sari-sari store and earns a monthly income of PHP 10,000.00 that sufficiently supports her family. Merlinda is a full fledged member of PMPC and has took several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default.

Now, she applied a loan to restock store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Merlinda continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Emelina

texts.en:
Emelina is 51 years old, married with three children, two of which are already working. She has a tricycle which her husband drives and she also sells mineral water by the gallons. A tricycle usually carries about four passengers. Jeepneys and buses are limited. Very few people own a vehicle. The town people usually ride a tricycle from their homes to market, church, to their friend’s homes and to other destinations within their community. They even transport from one town to the other.

A proper maintenance of her tricycle is required to ensure efficient and safe service, in view of this she is requesting a Php 13000 loan to pay for its maintenance and thus ensure continuous income. Part of the loan she will pay for several gallons of mineral water to serve her community. She is thanking you in advance for considering her request for it will greatly help sustain her source of income to provide for her family's needs.

Emelina dreams to put up other types of business to increase her income. She is a member of *Center of Community Transformation where she meets with co-fellowship members weekly to study the Word of God to draw strength and inspiration. Living in a third world country has many challenges but Emelina faces them with courage and faith in God. She prays for God's abundance in all aspects of their lives.* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her tricycle and gallons of mineral water to sell as well.

loans.name: Sherrilyn Rose

texts.en:
Sherrilyn Rose is 32 years old, married and has one child who is in school. 

Sherrilyn Rose is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Sherrilyn Rose requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Sherrilyn Rose has been raising pigs for twelve years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Sherrilyn Rose would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Xiomara Del Rosario

texts.es:
Xiomara, de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada, su pareja es agricultor y es quien lleva los granos básicos a la casa y solo tienen 1 hijo de 6 años de edad.

Xiomara, vende frutas de manera ambulante, ella compra la fruta, la prepara y luego sale a venderla casa por casa en la comunidad donde vive, tiene más de 5 años trabajando de la misma manera; ella empezó a vender fruta con su madre, quien le preparaba la mercadería y luego ella salía a venderla.- También trabajó como empleada doméstica y vendiendo de ropa; ahora diariamente recorre 2 kilómetros, desde las 7:00 a.m. hasta las 5:00 p.m. para vender la fruta.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar frutas como guayaba, pepino, sandía, melón, entre otras y también quiere comprar ropa para volver a vender, de esa manera espera poder obtener mejores ingresos y satisfacer las necesidades de su familia.

Ella sueña con ver a su hijo preparado académicamente y que sea profesional.
texts.en:
Xiomara is 26 years old and has a ninth-grade education. She has a partner, a farmer who brings home basic grains. The couple has only one child, a six-year-old boy.

Xiomara sells fruits as a street vendor. She buys the fruit, prepares it, then heads out to sell it door-to-door in her local community. Xiomara has been doing this work for five years. She started selling fruit with her mother, who prepared the fruit while Xiomara went out to sell it. Xiomara also used to work as a domestic servant and selling clothes. She now walks two kilometres every day in order to sell her produce. She works from 7am to 5pm selling fruits.

This loan will be used to buy fruits such as guayaba, cucumber, watermelon, melon and more, and to buy clothes to sell again. She thus hopes to earn a higher income and cover family necessities.

Xiomara dreams of seeing her son get a good education and becoming a professional.

loans.use: to buy fruits such as guayaba, cucumber, watermelon, melon and more, and to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 38 years old, married and has one child.

Maribel is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Maribel requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Maribel has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maribel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Faustino

texts.en:
Faustino is a 29 years old married, father of 2 children and is a teacher. Although the family works very hard, it can be difficult for them to afford the cost of their daughter’s education.
This loan of $1000 will allow Faustino to send his youngest daughter, Joanita, to post-secondary school. She will have more opportunities and a better life. The money will be used to cover educational costs including to pay for tuition , books, pens and other school supplies.

Faustino loves his daughter very much and In the future, Faustino hopes that his children are all well educated and knowledgeable.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's tuition, books, pens and other school supplies.

loans.name: Bendito

texts.en: Bendito lives in Suai, he is married and has been involved in business activities since 2004.  He started with his own working capital of $500. He is selling chicken, pork and other things. So he is requesting a loan of $800.00 from Tuba rai Metin because he wants to improve his business. So he took this loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy more of the things he needs and because he wants to improve the management of his business.

loans.use: to buy more chickens, pork and other things.

loans.name: Navruzbibi

texts.en: Navruzbibi is a hardworking woman. She was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1992. She is living in big beautiful village with her family. She is married and has two children. She has more than three years work experience in the field of sewing and tailoring. She sews Tajik traditional women dresses. She likes her activity very much and has permanent clients. She is satisfies to have income from her activity, she can help her husband with finance. She is willing to develop and increase her business in the future. She is sick. She needs to be treated at hospital. She came to IMON and asked a loan to be treated at hospital. She hopes KIVA lenders will support and take care of her. She wishes to be healthy and continue her activity.

loans.use: to be treated at hospital

loans.name: Joeralyn

texts.en: Joeralyn is a businesswoman who earns through hog raising and farming. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurances and financial assistance. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. She is on her way to renovating her house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

loans.name: Morita

texts.en: Morita is a 57-year-old woman from Baybay, Leyte. She is married with four adult children. Her husband is a farmer while Morita runs their sari-sari store. She has been doing this for almost 36 years and become proficient. Aside from this, she also sells charcoal to have additional income. Morita dreams to expand her sari-sari store business for a sustainable living. She is asking a loan to buy additional grocery items such as toiletries, spices, biscuits, chips, candies, coffee, powdered juice and chocolate drink, sugar, cooking oil, eggs, noodles and soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy toiletries, spices, biscuits, chips, candies, coffee, powdered juice and chocolate drink, sugar, cooking oil, eggs, noodles and soft drinks

loans.name: Ely

texts.en: Ely signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Ely is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales, these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store, with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

location.town: Oroquieta-Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Allnea

texts.en: Allnea had mastered managing her eatery business from buying ingredients, kitchen preparation, cooking and customer service. No wander that she has growing number of local customers knowingly she has palatable dishes. Recently, she avails a loan of PHP 7,000.00 to purchase meat, vegetables, spices and condiments for eatery business.

loans.use: to purchase meat, vegetables, spices and condiments for her eatery business.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is known in Pagadian City on her farming activities. She started as tenant of a wet puddy that she cultivates for a period of time. She hopes that she can have her own land to till so that her income will increased. Luckily she learns about Paglaum MPC from her neighbors and sign uo for membership. She access loan products to finance her farming needs. She finds success through it and buys her own land which she cultivates and this time, she asks for a loan to purchase bags of fertilizers. Rosalina is thankful to the cooperative and truly she believes that there is really hope in PAGLAUM.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: In 2007, Anita sign up for membership with Paglaum MPC and access its financial services for her farming business. She succcessfully repaid her loans without records of default payments. This cropping season, she wants to heads up and wants enough inventories of fertilizers that she asks for a loan of PHP 6,000.00. This amount will be used to purchase bags of fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian had mastered the craft of farming from land preparation, seed bed preparation, sowing, re-planting, farm management, harvesting and post harvest operation. She learn this from her farmer father. Now that she is married with school age kids, she wants to help her husband in providing the needs of her family through her farming activities. Recently, she asks for a loan from Paglaum MPC to pay for land preparation like plowing, harrowing, leveling and seed bed preparation.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation like plowing, harrowing, leveling and seed bed preparation

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is a microfinance member of PMPC. She is 61 years old, married, and a pensioner. She receives a monthly pension of PHP 7,500 per month. Recently, Myrna availed a loan to purchase bags of cements, plywood, nails and pay for labor cost. She wants to improve her family's living conditions and maintain her membership with the Cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cements, plywood, nails and pay for labor cost

loans.name: Shagaufta Group

texts.en:
Shagaufta is a 39 ,married woman living in Lahore,Pakistan. She is a mother of two daughters and two sons. Her husband is a shelter service provider for different events happening in the nearby surroundings and also far off places and can earn enough to support his entire family.

So his wife Shagaufta applied for the loan so that he could earn enough to give a boost in his income and support his family even better. Shagaufta is a thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC,Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy sheltering material such as bamboo, planks nails etc for her husband.

loans.name: Heylin Beatriz

texts.es:
Heylin es una joven de treinta y tres años de edad, muy emprendedora y de carácter fuerte, ella tiene un puesto de venta de ropa y zapatos usados. Ella ha descubierto que este negocio es muy bueno si se maneja una excelente administración. 
Le ha ido tan bien y confía tanto que ha decidido recurrir a un préstamo de Kiva junto a MiCrédito, con el cual planea invertir en la compra de zapatos para damas en todas las tallas y de estilos variados. En futuro desea poner su tienda en alguno de los mercados más concurridos de su ciudad y explorar otros negocios, como la venta de cosméticos.
texts.en:
Heylin is 33 years old, very enterprising, and has a strong character. She has owns a store, where she sells used clothes and shoes. She has discovered that this kind of business goes very well if she manages an excellent administration.

She is doing well and is so confident that she decided to request a loan from Kiva and MiCredito, which she will invest into buying lady's shoes in all sizes and various styles. In the future she wants to move her store into one of her city's busier markets and explore other businesses, like selling cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy lady's shoes in all sizes and various styles.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Doña Ángela, es una mujer de sesenta y seis años de edad, llena de vitalidad y ganas de trabajar, ella tiene una tienda en uno de los mercados de su ciudad, desde hace cincuenta y un años es comerciante. Cuenta con el incondicional apoyo de su hija.
Ella ha recurrido a la ayuda de Kiva junto a MiCrédito, para que se le brinde un financiamiento que le permita comprar ropa al por mayor, lo que implica un ahorro en sus costos y una mejor ganancia. Ella quiere ver su negocio lo más fuerte posible, para poder retirarse y disfrutar a sus nietos.
texts.en:
Angela is 66 years old, full of life and a drive to work. She owns a store in one of her city's markets, and has been a merchant for 51 years. She has the unconditional support of her daughter.

She is requesting a loan from Kiva and MiCredito, which offers her the funds that will allow her to buy cloths in bulk, which means a saving in her expenses and a higher profit.

She wants her business to be as strong as possible to be able to retire and enjoy her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy clothing at wholesale.

loans.name: Elevi

texts.es:
ELEVI TIENE 29 AÑOS DE EDAD, CONVIVIENTE, VIVE CON SU CONYUGE Y SUS 02 HIJOS EN CASA PROPIA, EN UNA COMUNIDAD, DEDICADA A LA AGRICULTURA, COMERCIO Y GANADERIA, CONOCIDA POR SUS DULCES TIPICOS, EN EL DISTRITO DE ZAÑA, PROVINCIA CHICLAYO, REGION LAMBAYEQUE COSTA NORTE DE PERU.

ELEVI SE DEDICA A PRESTAR SERVICIO COMO JORNALERO AGRICOLA EN SU ZONA Y ALREDEDORES, DESDE HACE VARIOS AÑOS, CON MUY BUENAS REFERENCIAS PERSONALES Y LABORALES,CON EL CRÉDITO COMPRARA ANIMALES Y COMIDAS PARA DEDICARSE A LA CRIANZA Y VENTA DE ESTOS, EL CREDITO A OTORGARLE LE FACILITARA OBTENER INGRESOS ADICIONALES Y MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Elevi is 29 years old, married, and lives with his spouse and their two children in their own house.

They live in a community, where people earn a living in agriculture, trade, and raising livestock. It is know for its typical candy, and located in the district of Zaña, Province of Chiclayo, region of Lambayeque, on the north coast Peru.

Elevi has been earning a living for several years offering his services as a agriculture day worker in his area. He has a very good personal and professional reputation.

With this loan he will buy animals and food to make a living by raising an selling them. The granted loan will facilitate him to get additional income and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animals and food to fatten and sell them.

loans.name: Grimael

texts.es:
Grimael tiene 35 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Pomahuaca que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Grimael se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de cacao, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 10 años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de cacao así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Grimael espera ofrecer un cacao de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Grimael is 35 years old. He lives with his partner and children in his own rustic house, in the district of Pomahuaca, which is located in the province of Jaén, Cajamarca Region, in the northern highlands of Peru. Life in this district is calm and the people here mainly work in agriculture, business and livestock.

Grimael works in agriculture, specifically cocoa production. He has 10 years of experience in this field and many good personal and work references in the area. The loan that he will be granted will be used to buy compost and fertilizers for proper maintenance of his cocoa production, as well as to hire labor for harvest time. With the loan, Grimael hopes to offer better quality cocoa to his customers, which will have a positive impact on his income level and thus will improve the quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers for proper maintenance of his cocoa production.

loans.name: Jose Rigoberto

texts.es:
José, utiliza los créditos como herramientas para mantener la producción de granos básicos, su familia se mantiene con el mismo núcleo, él ha tenido dificultades de salud pero no pierde la motivación para continuar trabajando y salir adelante con los suyos.
Hace la solicitud de un nuevo crédito para poder comprar básicamente abono, semilla, insecticidas y herbicidas para la siembra de temporada, espera tener cosechas abundantes.
texts.en:
Jose uses the loans like tools to maintain his production of basic grains. In the same way he cares about his family.

He has had health issues but does not lose the motivation to keep working and getting ahead with what he has.

He is requesting a new loan basically to be able to buy fertilizer, seeds, insecticides, and pesticides for this seasons sowing time. He is hoping for an abundant crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, insecticides, and herbicides for this seasons sowing time.

loans.name: Gloria Elizeth

texts.es:
Gloria hoy en día tiene un negocio más amplio y con más demandas de sus clientes, cree que es de mucha importancia solicitar un nuevo crédito para comprar telas, botones, hilos y otros accesorios para equipar la sastrería, asimismo invertirá en ropa ya fabricada para dama y otros accesorios, para incrementar sus entradas de dinero y cumplir con sus obligaciones.
El capital que con anterioridad se le presto  le sirvió para tener todo lo necesario para elaborar prendas de vestir en su sastrería, ha incluido la venta de ropa para dama para atender mejor a sus clientes, su núcleo familiar se mantiene y su situación económica ha mejorado.
texts.en:
Gloria now owns a bigger business with a larger demand by customers. She believes it is very important to request another loan to buy fabric, buttons, thread, and other accessories to equip her tailor's shop, and also to invest in women's clothing and other accessories to increase her income and fulfill her obligations.

The capital from her previous loan served her to have everything she needed to make clothing in her tailor's shop. She included selling women's clothing to better serve her customers. She supports her close family and her financial situation has improved.

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons, thread, and other accessories to equip her tailor's shop, and also to invest in women's clothing.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Desde muy temprano, Ana una mujer de treinta y nueve años de edad, echa andar su cocina, para cumplir con los pedidos de desayuno, almuerzo y cena que vende a trabajadores de las empresas en su ciudad. Ella tiene quince años de dedicarse a la venta de comida, gracias a los créditos que se le han brindado antes ella ha logrado sacar adelante su negocio y a su familia, por eso está muy agradecida. 
Ha tocado las puertas de Kiva junto a MiCrédito para que se le brinde una oportunidad de financiamiento que le deje abastecerse de productos y comprar aceite, arroz, frijoles, verduras, entre otros productos que ocupa dia a dia para la elaboración de su comida. En un futuro desea poder abrir en su casa de habitación un pequeño restaurante.
texts.en:
From very early in the morning, Ana, a 39-year old woman, gets her kitchen going to take the breakfast, lunch and dinner orders from the business workers in her city. She has been selling food for 15 years. Thanks to the loans she has been given previously, she has been able to support her business and her family. She is very thankful for that.

She has knocked on the doors of Kiva, along with MiCrédito, to be given another financial opportunity that allows her to supply herself with products and buy oil, rice, beans, vegetables, and other products that she uses every day to make her food. In the future, she wants to be able to open a small restaurant in her house.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, beans, vegetables and others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies such as meats, flour, soft drinks, butter, condiments, vegetables, rice, etc., to make and sell food.

loans.name: Omar Antonio

texts.es:
Omar, está necesitando de un crédito para comprar una pulidora, un compresor, un soldador, laminas y hierro para renovar el equipo de trabajo de su taller de estructuras metálicas y además tendrá parte del material para entregar sus trabajos en el tiempo solicitado.
Con los financiamientos don Omar mantiene su negocio funcionando, sus ingresos son de subsistencia, la familia se mantiene unida con muchos de deseos de superarse.
texts.en: Omar is needing a loan to buy a polisher, a compressor, a soldering iron, metal sheets and iron to renovate the equipment in his metal structures workshop. He will also have part of the material to deliver his jobs on time. With the fundings, Omar keeps his business functioning. He is surviving on his income and his family stays together with many hopes of exceeding.

loans.use: to buy a polisher, a compressor, a soldering iron, metal sheets and iron to renovate the equipment in his metal structures workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a bunch of clothing at a fairly low price, and offer her customers better merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Ysabel

texts.es:
María Ysabel tiene 35 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una zona rural donde su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú.

María se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, cuenta con experiencia de 5 años, en este negocio y con clientes fijos que brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de mercadería para aumentar el stock de su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia lo que le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
María Ysabel is 35 years old. She lives with her husband and children in the district of Oyotún. It is a rural area where the people work in agriculture, business and livestock. It is located in the Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.

María works selling groceries. She has 5 years experience in this business and has regular customers who give her very good personal and work references.

She is asking for a loan to buy a larger quantity of merchandise to increase her business stock. This way she can get a better income for her family, which will allow her to improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of merchandise to increase her business stock.

loans.name: Kenny Beatriz

texts.es:
Kenny, a su edad ya es madre de dos niños, ella sola tiene que sacarlos adelante, vive junto a ellos en casa de su madre, se dedica a vender elotes asados frente a un parque, con un horario de tres de la tarde a seis de la mañana, tiene que viajar a la ciudad para comprar la materia prima de su negocio a un costo más bajo y realiza está actividad desde hace 2 años.
Con el crédito comprara elotes y carbón para mantener la continuidad de su negocio, también tiene planeado invertir una parte del dinero en pólvora para iniciar a vender otro tipo de producto, así espera tener nuevos clientes para la temporada de fin de año. Espera lograr tener un negocio más competitivo.
Sus aspiraciones son tener más ingresos, cancelar la deuda y dar el sustento diario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Kenny is a mother of two children at her age. She has to support them by herself. She lives with them in her mother's house. She works selling grilled corn cobs in front of a park and her schedule is from 3 PM to 6 AM. She has to travel to the city to buy the business materials at a lower price and she has been doing this for 2 years.

With the loan, she will buy ears of corn and coal to maintain business continuity. She also plans to invest part of the money in gunpowder to start selling another type of product. She hopes to have new customers for the end of the year season. She hopes to have a more competitive business. Her dreams are to have more income, pay off her debt and give her children daily support.

loans.use: to buy ears of corn and coal to maintain business continuity. She also plans to invest part of the money in gunpowder to start selling another type of product.

loans.name: Aissatou's Group

texts.fr:
Créé le 12 Octobre 2010, ce banc villageois est composé de femmes qui habitent  toute le même village .Elles ont comme activité le petit commerce et sont très solidaires entre elles.

Madame Aissatou, âgée de 55ans (debout à l’extrême  droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est veuve et mère de 04 filles et 05 garçons. Elle s’active dans la vente de produits alimentaires (oignons, pomme de terre, sel, poivre etc. ...)

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter différents produits cités ci-dessus en gros d’un montant de 50000f par semaine dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour le revendre en détails dans son village.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte augmenter faire de l’embouche, payer la scolarité, la nourriture et l’habillement de ses enfants.
texts.en: Created on October 12th 2010, this village bank is composed of women who all live in the same village.  They have small businesses as their activity and really support each other.  Mrs. Aissatou, who is 55 years old (at the far right raising her hand) is the star borrower of the group.  She is a widow and the mother of 4 girls and 5 boys.  She is active in the selling of food products (onions, potatoes, salt, pepper etc...) With her new loan, she plans to buy these different products in bulk at the weekly markets for 50,000f per week to resell individually in her village.  With the profits, she hopes to be able to raise animals and pay for her children's schooling, food and clothing.

loans.use: to buy different products in bulk at the weekly markets, costing 50,000f per week, to be resold individually in the village

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
Nieves is a farmer in Pagadian City. She is a MIGS member of Paglaum MPC and has received numerous loans that have financed her farming activities. Nieves maintains her membership, evidencing that she has no record of default payments.

Recently, she has asked for a loan to purchase bags of fertilizers so she can be prepared for this cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Santos Marixa

texts.es:
Santos tiene 56 años de edad, es soltera, vive sola, en una zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Santos se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Santos espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Santos is 56 years old. She is single and lives alone in a rural area in the district of Cayaltí, which is located in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. The people of this district mainly work in agriculture, livestock and business.

Santos works breeding and selling small animals like ducks, turkeys and others. Her business is located in her home. She has years of experience in the business and has many good personal and work references in the area.

The loan that she is asking for will be used to buy a larger quantity of animals such as hens, ducks, turkeys, chickens, and others, as well as buying balanced food for them. With the loan, Santos hopes to offer a better product to her customers, which will allow her to get a better income and thus increase the quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of animals.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramon tiene 38 años de edad, vive con sus padres en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pavos, gallinas, patos, cuyes, entre otros. Cuenta con 05 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El destino del préstamo será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como patos, cuyes, gallinas, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Ramon espera ofrecer mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes, lo que se verá reflejado en un mayor nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ramon is 38 years old. He lives with his parents in the district of Cayaltí, located in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. He lives in a community dedicated to business, agriculture and livestock.

He makes a living breeding and selling small animals such as turkeys, hens, ducks, guinea pigs, and others. He has 5 years of experience in this business and has very good personal and work references in the area.

The destiny of the loan will be to buy a larger quantity of animals such as ducks, guinea pigs, hens and others, as well as buying balanced food for them. With the loan, Ramon hopes to offer a better variety of animals to his customers, which will reflect a greater income level and will improve the quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of animals.

loans.name: Baghagha Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 20 juin 2002. Ce groupe est composé de trois femmes qui développent des activités commerciales. Madame Siré qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 33 ans et mère de cinq enfants dont deux filles. Elle s'active depuis plus de cinq ans dans la vente de tissus wax et nganila. Elle va acheter avec le crédit sollicité des wax et des nganila. Elle maitrise parfaitement son activité. Les bénéfices vont servir à aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et à payer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The banc villageois was inaugurated on 20th June 2002. This group is made up of three women who develop commercial activities.

Mrs Siré, who is on the right of the photo raising her hand, is the group representative. She is married, 33 years old and the mother of five children including two girls. She has been working for over five years in the sale of wax and nganila fabrics. With the requested loan, she will purchase wax and nganila cloth. She has perfect mastery of her activity.

The profits will be used to help her husband with the daily expenses and to pay for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy wax and nganila fabrics.

loans.name: Baghagha Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 20 juin 2002. Ce groupe est composé de vingt femmes braves qui mènent comme activité le commerce. Madame Awa qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 47 ans et mère de sept enfants dont quatre filles. Elle s'active dans la vente de poissons fumés et des crevettes séchés depuis plus de dix ans. Elle va acheter avec le prêt sollicité trois paniers de poissons fumés et deux cartons de crevettes séchés. Elle est la seule qui mènent cette activité dans le secteur. les bénéfices vont servir à aider son mari à la prise charge de la famille.
texts.en:
This village bank was opened on June 20th, 2002. This group is composed of 20 brave women who manage their businesses. Mrs. Awa, who is on the right of the photo raising her hand, is the leader of the group. She is married, is 47 years old and is the mother of seven children, four of which are girls.
She has been active in the selling of smoked fish and dried shrimp for more than ten years. She will buy, with the requested loan, three baskets of smoked fish and two cartons of dried shrimp. She is the only one who manages this activity in her area. The profits will be used to help her husband with supporting the family.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish and dried shrimp

loans.name: Baghagha Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 20 juin 2002. Ce groupe est composé se sept femmes dynamique qui font le commerce. Madame Dieneba Coumba qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est marié, âgée de 38 ans et mère de six enfants dont quatre garçons. Elle s'active dans la vente de tissus teintés depuis plus de sept ans. Elle est douée dans son activité et elle est la seule dans le coin à faire cette activité. Les bénéfices vont servir à assurer la scolarité de ses enfants, à acheter de la nourriture et à régler ses propres affaires.
texts.en:
The banc villageois was inaugurated on the 20th of June 2002. This group is made up of seven dynamic women who engage in trade.

Mrs Dieneba Coumba, who is on the right of the photo raising her hand, is the group representative. She is married, 38 years old and the mother of six children including four boys. She has been selling dyed cloth for over seven years. She is talented in her activity and is the only person around to practise this trade.

The profits will be used to ensure her children's schooling, to buy food and to take care of her own business.

loans.use: to buy dyed cloth.

loans.name: Segundo Armando

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 31 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su cónyuge en el distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente al comercio y crianza de ganado menor.

Segundo se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su vehículo (mototaxi), actividad que realiza desde hace más de 5 años, cuenta con experiencia en el sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será utilizado para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, con esto Segundo espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Segundo is 31 years old. He has a domestic partner and lives with her in the district of Cayaltí, located in the province of Chiclayo, region of Lambayeque, on the northern coast of Peru. Life in this community is quiet. Its inhabitants work mainly in commerce and raising small animals. Segundo works rendering transportation services in his vehicle, a motorcycle-taxi, to passengers. He has worked in this job for more than 5 years. He has experience in the business and very good personal and work references in the region. He will use the loan to make repairs and do maintenance work to his vehicle, since it is now in bad condition. With this, Segundo hopes to offer his customers better service and to generate bigger income; and consequently, his quality of life and that of his family will improve.

loans.use: to make repairs and do maintenance work to his vehicle.

loans.name: Akuwa Mawupemo

texts.fr: Akuwa est une femme mariée âgée de 30 ans résidant à Tokoin. Mère d’un enfant, Akuwa est une revendeuse de chaussures qui s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché et le revend  dans les quartiers environnant. Akuwa demande ce prêt pour commander des unités de chaussures tapettes et mi- pied afin de répondre favorablement aux besoins de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière considérable pour aider son enfant à s’épanouir et avoir une bonne éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Akuwa is a married thirty year old woman living in Tokoin. Mother to one child, Akuwa sells shoes and gets her supplies four times per month at the market, she resells in surrounding neighbourhoods.

Akuwa is requesting this loan to order units of flip-flops and mid-foot shoes so as to respond favourably to her clients' needs. She wants to have a significant financial autonomy so that she can help her child to grow and have a good school education.

loans.use: to buy three units of flip-flops and five units of mid-foot shoes.

loans.name: Las Coronadas Group

texts.es: Conformado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras y luchadoras se encuentra en grupo ¨Las Coranadas¨, coordinador Reyna de 42 años, casada y con dos hijos de edades 20 y 14 años, se dedica a la producción de frescos, hielo y distribución de gaseosa y productos lácteos, desde hace 10 años, con el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja como guarda de seguridad. Solicita dinero para comprar en mayores cantidades gaseosas, lácteos, leche agria, jugos de lata tropicales y bebidas energizantes. Asi aumentara su inventario y las ganancias iran en aumento. Las otras integrantes son Lilliam, 55 años, dedicada a la venta de ropa y cosméticos de manera ambulante. Wendy de 30 años se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado
texts.en:
The group "Las Coranadas" is made up of 3 entrepreneurial and hard working women. Reyna is the coordinator. She's 42 years old and has 2 children of 20 and 14 years of age. She's been selling juices, ice, and distributing dairy products and sodas for more than 10 years with the support of her husband who works as a security guard.
She's requesting the money to buy larger quantities of sodas, dairy products, sour milk, canned tropical juices and energy drinks. In this way she'll increase her inventory and her earnings.
The other members are Lilliam who is 55 years old and sells clothes and cosmetics door to door, and Wendy who is 30 years old and sells clothes and shoes.

loans.use: buy larger quantities of sodas, dairy products, sour milk, canned tropical juices and energy drinks.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Doña Reina, tiene 47 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja y reside en una aldea del municipio de Quimistán, Santa Barbara junto a su conyugue. En busca de obtener ingresos decidió poner su propio negocio, hace 5 años que vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como ser: maíz, frijoles, churros, manteca, azúcar, arroz, pan, condimentos, productos de limpieza y otros abarrotes. Con este negocio ayuda a su familia. Ha decidido solicitar un prestamo por 20,000 lempiras para surtir con nuevos productos como lácteos, carnes, embutidos, refrescos, churros, productos de limpieza, y granos básicos y poder mejorar las ventas. Su idea es mantener el negocio y crecer como comerciante para darle mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Reina is 47 years old, she shares a home with her partner and lives in a town in the area of Quimistán, Santa Barbara.

Five years ago, looking for a stable income, Reina decided to start her own business, selling basic household products such as corn, beans, cooking fat, sugar, rice, bread, condiments, cleaning products and other items.

This business has helped Reina and her family. Reina has decided to seek a loan for 20,000 lempiras to stock her business with new products such as dairy products, meat, preserved meats, drinks, cleaning products and basic grains to increase her sales.

Reina believes this will help her to not only maintain but also to increase her business and thus give her family the best life possible.

loans.use: to buy dairy products, meat, preserved meats, drinks, doughnuts, cleaning products and basic grains to increase her sales.

loans.name: Yulita

texts.en:
Yulita is 59 years old and married with six adult aged children. She engages in the farming business which gives her a quarterly income of PHP 12,000 that sufficiently responds to the needs of her family.

She is also a member of Paglaum MPC and had availed various loans in the past. Recently, she has taken advantage of a loan purchase bags of fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: El Chilamate Ii Group

texts.es: El grupo ¨Chilamate II¨esta nuevamente solicitando crédito para el desarrollo y crecimientos de sus negocios, así mejorar sus condiciones de vida que le permitan salir adelante a sus familias. Coordinado pro Leila, de 45 años, casada y con 2 hijos de edades 7 y 5 años de edad. Tiene su pequeño taller de costura y se dedica a la elaboración de delantares, faldas colegiales y faldas de vestir en su domicilio. El dinero solicitado lo requiere para la compra de materiales para la producción como tela dacron, tiras, zypers, bipiur, perlas y margaritas. Así la producción será mas efectiva y podrá ofrecer mas variedad a su clientela. Las otras socias son Isolda, de 24 años y Marlyn de 31 años ambas también se dedican a la costura y elaboran delantares en sus respectivos domicilios para luego comercializarlos.
texts.en: E ¨Chilamate II¨ Group is requesting another loan to develop and grow their businesses, and in this way improve their quality of life and allow them to move their families forward. This group is coordinated by 45 year old Leila, who is married and has two children, ages 7 and 5. She has a small sewing shop and works from home making aprons, school skirts and dressy skirts. She needs the requested money to buy materials for production such as: Dacron fabric, strips, zippers, lace, pearls and daisies. In this way, production will be more effective and she will be able to offer more variety to her customers. The other members are Isolda, 24 years old, and Marlyn, 31 years old. Both work also in the sewing business and make aprons in their respective homes for further sale.

loans.use: to buy Dacron fabric, strips, zippers, lace, pearls and daisies.

loans.name: Urcisina

texts.en:
For more than 20 years, Urcisina has been operating a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells commodities like seasonings, sugar, cooking oil, coffee, eggs, tuba (coconut wine), toiletries, soft drinks and toiletries.

She is a 66-year-old married woman with five grown children. She hails from the town of Loon, Bohol. She is running out of capital to sustain her current source of income.

She has requested a loan to buy supplies like tuba, soft drinks and assorted goods. These will keep her store full of stock and attract more buyers to come. Thus, her earnings will improve and she could pay her obligation. In the long run, Urcisina will be able to expand her business and also start to save for the future.

She hopes that her source of income will become successful and productive for a sustainable living.

loans.use: to buy supplies like tuba, soft drinks and assorted goods

loans.name: Repay In Time - N3T8Qlưu Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hoa is 52 years old and she is married. She has been working in agriculture raising poultry for 7 years.Hoa lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region. Also, the income from this business is unstable because when some disease descends on poultry, they could die, leaving her nothing to sell, causing financial troubles.

The main hardship that Hoa faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

In 2014, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Hoa has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the group leader of "Repay in time - N3T8QLưu", which consists of 3 members. With her business profit, Hoa hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to go to school.

loans.use: To purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is 43 years old. She is married and has six children. Her business is operating a posho mill. She has been in this business for 10 years.

She earns a monthly income of fifty five thousand shillings. This is her eighth loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to upgrade her posho mill.

Angeline will use the profits from expanding her business by opening another posho mill. Her hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to upgrade her posho mill.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en: Farming has been the life of Carolina. She is a 68-year-old married woman with adult children in Lawa-an, Aloran, Mis. Occ. Caolina sent all her children in school through her farming activities that, despite her age, she still chooses to manage her own farm. Now, she asks for a loan to purchase bags of fertilizers. She wants to have enough stocks of fertilizers for this cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elvira is 49 years old now.

Elvira has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Elvira requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other supplies for the maintenance of her business.

Elvira has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Elvira would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other supplies for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Houeida 1 Group

texts.en:
Lina is the featured borrower of Houeida 1 Group. She joined the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends, and they are working hard on developing their families' social and financial situations.

Lina is a 42-year-old married mother. She has been working in selling women's clothes since 22 years ago. She is a good support for her family and her beloved husband and is working hard on developing her business properly.

Today, her acquired loan will be invested in increasing her business merchandise with a special collection for the upcoming autumn. This will help her in developing her family's living.

Lina is the lady at the center of the picture.

Houeida is 28, married, and a mother of one child. She works as a hairdresser, and is the first lady at the far left side of the picture. Rima is the first from the right, 46, and a married mother of one child.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a special collection for the upcoming autumn.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is 35 years old. He is married and has three children.

His business is a retail shop. He has been in this business for 10 years. He earns a monthly income of 48,000 Kenya shillings.

This is his fifth loan with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy stock of soap, sugar, tissue paper, cooking oil, maize flour etc.

He will use the profits from the expanded business to improve the living standard of his family. His hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy stock of soap, sugar, tissue paper, cooking oil, maize flour etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to boost her food sales by buying more food items and a freezer  for her restaurant.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 53 years old. She is married and has five children. Her business is running a green grocery stall. She has been in this business for five years. Josephine earns a monthly income of 18,000 KES (Kenya shillings). This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy stocks of potatoes, tomatoes, cabbages, onions, carrots, and the like.  She will use the profits from her expanded business to educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to have a financially stable family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, including potatoes, tomatoes, cabbages, onions and carrots.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 39 years old. She is married and has three children. Her business is operating a quarry. She has been in this business for 10 years. She earns a monthly income of 9,000 KES (Kenya shillings). This is her third loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to lease more land for her quarry. She will use the profits from her expanded business to educate her children and will also increase her savings. Her hopes and dreams are to expand her business and improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to lease more land for her stone quarry.

loans.name: Cesara

texts.en: Cesara is 53 years old, married, and has three children. She works hard to provide for her family. Cesara runs a general store  in the Philippines and applied for a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as snack food, beverages, home care products, and other groceries. Cesara has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years, and earns additional income from food vending. Cesara aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, including snack food, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra, age 50, is a responsible mother for three children, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband owns a scrap shop; he deals with the scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles and waste papers. He has been purchasing scrap goods from the common people and sells it to the recycling factories.

Nowadays, because of household expenses, he does not have enough money to buy scrap goods and does not have scrap to sell for getting money. Therefore, Azra requested a loan for her husband, so that he can buy more quantity of material to recycle and make some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents.

She is very impressed with this honorable support and shows her wish to take more loans after the payment of this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more quantity of material to recycle for her husband's scrap business.

loans.name: Silveria

texts.en: Silveria has a snack vending business that supplies nearby school canteens. She makes various kinds of snacks that are delicious and suitable for her immediate market. She is grateful that her little business is supported by Paglaum MPC. Through this partnership, Silveria will be able to produce more food products for her costumers. Recently, she took out a loan to buy ingredients, such as bags of flour, sugar, milk, cheese and butter, for her snack vending business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients, including bags of flour, sugar, milk, cheese and butter, for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Because I Am Happy - N4T6Qlưu Group

texts.en:
Sâm is 42 years old and she is married. Sâm lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

She has been working in agriculture, raising poultry, for seven years. Her family is a low-income household in a village, and the market need is low in this region. Moreover, income from this business is unstable because poultry diseases can kill the birds, leaving her nothing to sell. So she will be in trouble with finance.

The main hardship that Sâm faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

In 2014, Sâm joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Sâm has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She is the group leader of "Because I am happy - N4T6QLưu", which consists of three members.

With her business profit, Sâm hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Mustafë

texts.en:
Mustafë is 60 years old but he says that he feels like he is 40. Because he feels so much younger and is healthy, he has a 10-year-old daughter. He had always wanted a child for a long time and now he has been able to have one and is a very good father, who loves his daughter very much. He is dedicated and wants to be able to give her whatever she needs.

He has been the main source of income, generating his money from his family tradition of agriculture. He has land where he plants corn and wheat and sells it. He also used to have cows, but in order to be able to pay for some of the family's expenses, he had to sell them.

Now, he is requesting a loan in order to purchase a milk cow. He knows that this loan is from the Kiva lenders, and he wants to thank them all for the support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Reynaldo Jose

texts.es:
Reynaldo es una persona activo, que se caracteriza por su responsabilidad y constancia en sus labores, a pesar de no tener un gran negocio, de no generar grandes utilidades, con su humilde venta de alimentos genera los ingresos suficientes para cubrir las necesidades de su familia.
Reynaldo siempre tenía que producir la misma cantidad ya que no disponía del capital para mejorar su capacidad de producción y no encontraba entidades en las cuales apoyarse, pero gracias a la corporación Interactuar quien está dispuesta a tenderle la mano puede recurrir una ayuda económica que utilizará en la compra de una estufa, utensilios y materia prima para preparar sus alimentos. Su principal ventaja es que aumentará su producción ya que tiene la demanda suficiente para hacerlo, ganara mayor capital y mejorara las condiciones de vida de él y su familia la cual está conformada por su pareja e hijo de 7 años de edad.
texts.en:
Reynaldo is an active person who is characterized by his responsibility and diligence in his work. Although he does not have a large business, and does not generate large profits, with his modest food sales he generates sufficient income to cover his family’s needs.
Reynaldo always had to produce the same amount, as he didn’t have the capital to improve his production capacity, and he could not find any institutions to support him. But thanks to the Interacturar corporation, who is willing to lend him a hand, he can receive economic help that he will use to buy a stove, utensils, and raw material to prepare his food. His main advantage is that he will increase his production, as he has enough demand for this, he will get more capital, and will improve the conditions of life for himself and his family, which is made up of his spouse and his 7 year old son.

loans.use: to buy a stove, kitchen utensils, and raw materials to increase his food production.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 44 years old and widowed with seven children. With five children in school, Merlita works very hard to provide for them.

Merlita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, biscuits, junk foods, personal care products, and other groceries.

Merlita has been in this business for 9 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Merlita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, biscuits, junk foods, personal care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en:
Rashida is a 50-year-old married mother of two children who has run her own home-based tailoring business since 2008. She has twenty-five years of experience in this business.
Rashida specializes in tailoring for special occasions and making wedding dresses, and she is very skilled in this.
Today, Rashida is working hard to improve her workplace since it is home-based, so a loan acquired from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua will be used to fix her home's ceiling and cover it with brick before the coming winter season to keep it a healthy place to live.
Rashida has a dream which she hopes will come true soon, which is to open a large tailoring workshop and recruit others to support her.

loans.use: to fix her home's ceiling and cover it with brick before the coming winter season to keep it a healthy place to live.

loans.name: Leidis Sofia

texts.es:
Ella es Leidis una joven de 24 años de edad, con todo un futuro por delante, vive en el municipio de Montería, una zona muy afectada por la pobreza y una fuerte sequía que acabo con cultivos. Sus padres de tradición realizan actividades agrícolas y ella entiende y sabe realizar la profesión, es por este motivo que se atreve a solicitar una ayuda económica para iniciar un negocio de cría de ganado, cuenta con los terrenos y con la suerte de que las lluvias han vuelto a Montería.
El capital será invertido en la compra de 4 terneros y alimento de engorde.
Leidis no tiene hijos, la principal razón por la que quiere ser emprendedora es que busca ser auto-sostenible y ayudar a sus familiares a superar una difícil situación monetaria que están atravesando, por ende pondrá todas las ganas y entusiasmo que siempre la caracterizan para hacer que este negocio sea un éxito.
texts.en:
Leidis is a young 24-year-old woman with her whole life ahead of her. She lives in the town of Montería, an area that has been hard hit by poverty and a severe drought that finished off the crops. Her parents made a living though farming work, and she understands and knows how to do this work. This is why she dared to ask for a loan to start a business breeding cattle. She has the land and, luckily, the rains have returned to Montería.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of 4 calves and food to fatten them up. Leidis has no children, the main reason she wants to be an entrepreneur is that she hopes to be self-sufficient and help her family to overcome a difficult financial situation that they are experiencing. Ultimately she will put all the excitement and enthusiasm that is part of her character into making this business a success.

loans.use: to buy 4 calves and food to fatten them up.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: This is Rose, who is in her fourth year studying for her Bachelor's degree in Development. Her older sister was supporting her to help pay for the tuition costs after she lost her job.
